Acrobatic Climber.name: Acrobatic Climber
Acrobatic Climber.description: You use Acrobatics to Climb instead of Athletics.

Advanced Training.name: Advanced Training
Advanced Training.description:
You've trained with your eldamon extensively in a variety of techniques, and all that training paid off by increasing their versatility. Your eldamons' proficiency bonus to their untrained skills becomes equal to their level. Additionally your eldamon gain four attribute boosts, one to each of their four lowest attributes. This typically increases their four lowest modifiers from +2, +1, +0, and –1 to +3, +2, +1, and +0.

Your eldamon also gain several other proficiencies and abilities at 5th level, including the capacity to learn an additional power, although it does so even if you don't have this class feature.

By training side by side, you improve your own capabilities, not just your eldamons'. This allows you to prepare to phase four eldamon each day, instead of three, as long as your key attribute modifier is at least +4.

Aetheric Spikes.name: Aetheric Spikes
Aetheric Spikes.description: You are covered in spikes made of aether that damage your foes with force. A creature that attempts a melee unarmed Strike or a non-reach melee Strike against you (whether or not it hits you) takes @Damage[4[force]] damage, with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save against your power DC. At 19th level, this increases to @Damage[5[force]] damage.

Aetheric Third Eye.name: Aetheric Third Eye
Aetheric Third Eye.description: You have a third eye of aether, concentrated force energy mixed with etheric essence into elemental form, and that third eye allows you to perceive things geometrically through forces. You automatically succeed on flat checks to target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} creatures.

Air Antennae.name: Air Antennae
Air Antennae.description: Your antennae provide you the ability to smell things from a distance. You gain scent as an imprecise sense out to 60 feet. As normal for scent, this is adjusted based on if the source of the smell is upwind or downwind.

Air Element.name: Air Element
Air Element.description:
The element of air represents the breezy, capricious, constantly moving nature of air. Thus, air powers often move the user around the battlefield or attack from a great distance. All air powers that allow the user to Stride also allow the user to Fly if they have a fly Speed.

Associated Damage Type: Slashing

Associated Traits: Air

Other Abilities

If your element is air, you gain the following abilities and effects from the Elemental Surge action, the Elemental Shield action, and the elemental avatar feats that vary by element.

Elemental Locomotion When you use your air powers, you can Fly for a time, even though you can't Fly normally. While using your air powers that allow you to Fly if you have a fly Speed, if you use the power on a solid surface, you can Fly up to your normal land Speed. If you end the movement somewhere that can't support your weight, such as in mid-air, you fall.

Elemental Manipulation When you use Elemental Manipulation, you can control air and wind in minor ways, allowing you to create or calm down light breezes. This can help cool you down in hot temperatures, similarly to wearing a warm weather outfit, make it harder to detect you via scent by making you downwind (unless the wind is blowing strongly in the other direction), and the like. At your GM's discretion, you can make other small adjustments to air and wind.

Elemental Resistance The winds are your allies, never your adversaries. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus on saving throws against air effects and if you roll a success on your saving throw, you get a critical success instead. Wind that would normally be difficult terrain isn't difficult terrain for you, and wind that would normally be greater difficult terrain is only standard difficult terrain for you. If you have the Enhanced Resistance feat, your circumstance bonus against air effects increases to +2, wind that would normally be greater difficult terrain isn't difficult terrain at all for you, and if you roll a critical failure on a saving throw against an air effect, you get a failure instead.

Elemental Sculptor When you use the Elemental Sculptor feat, you can move and control air and wind to a greater extent than Elemental Manipulation. This allows you to create enough wind to make an area difficult terrain for fliers or provide a –1 circumstance penalty to physical ranged attacks that move through the area, or slow down wind at a similar speed. When you sculpt, you affect roughly one 10-foot by 10-foot square or less, though the wind typically lasts 1 minute at most. At the GM's discretion, you can make other similar adjustments to air and wind's shape or position.

Elemental Senses The wind carries all sorts of scents your way, granting you an extremely keen sense of smell. You gain scent as an imprecise sense out to 30 feet. As normal for scent, the range is typically reduced when you're upwind and increased when you're downwind.

Elemental Shield The shield also grants a +1 circumstance bonus to Reflex saves.

Elemental Surge You Stride up to half your normal land Speed, fly up to half your normal fly Speed (if you have one), or Step.

Enhanced Locomotion You can fly freely with the wind at your back. You gain a fly Speed equal to your land Speed at all times.

Air Unleashed.name: Air Unleashed
Air Unleashed.description: The unleashed power of air allows you to move with unrestricted mobility. Flying upward isn't difficult terrain to you, and you don't have to end the turn by descending to the ground, even if you aren't combined with an eldamon trainer using Melded Phase.

Air Wings.name: Air Wings
Air Wings.description: Your wings are formed entirely out of air, providing you significantly greater maneuverability in flight than most other creatures. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Acrobatics checks to Maneuver in Flight and Arrest a Fall.

Air's Reach.name: Air's Reach
Air's Reach.description: You carry your powers across greater distances with wings of air. Your air powers that have a range within a certain number of feet have their range extended by an additional 50%. This has no effect on the size of an area, such as the length of a line or cone, but it does allow you to place an area effect that has a range at a further distance from you.

Alertness.name: Alertness
Alertness.description: You remain alert to threats around you. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to expert.

All the Luck Charms.name: All the Luck Charms
All the Luck Charms.description: One of your many luck charms averts misfortune; this is a fortune effect, but it doesn't do anything but negate the misfortune effect. Afterward, you can't benefit from this ability for 1 round.

Amethyst Sled.name: Amethyst Sled
Amethyst Sled.description: You use a mind amethyst to sled across scattered rubble, sand, or snow with ease. You ignore difficult terrain from rubble, sand, or snow.

Amphibious Assault.name: Amphibious Assault
Amphibious Assault.description: You're especially quick both on land and in the sea. Your land Speed is 30 feet, despite being a water eldamon, and your swim Speed is 40 feet. This adjustment is included in the statblock.

Apex Training.name: Apex Training
Apex Training.description:
By pushing past your limits together, your training with your eldamon has achieved fantastic results, allowing your eldamon friends to express incredible powers. Your eldamon gains four attribute boosts, one to each of their three lowest attributes, and one to the attribute that was originally their second-highest.

Your eldamon also gain master proficiency in power DCs at 15th level as well as the capacity to learn an additional power, although it does so even if you don't have this class feature.

Pushing past your own limits while training with your eldamon grants you additional benefits as well. This allows you to prepare to phase one more eldamon each day, to a maximum of six eldamon, or your key attribute +1, whichever is lower.

Armor Spikes.name: Armor Spikes
Armor Spikes.description: You are covered in armored spikes that pierce your foes. A creature that attempts a melee unarmed Strike or a non-reach melee Strike against you (whether or not it hits you) takes @Damage[4[piercing]] damage, with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save against your power DC. At 19th level, this increases to @Damage[5[piercing]] damage.

Armor of Light.name: Armor of Light
Armor of Light.description: You wear armor formed of hardened light. Your item bonus to AC from armor increases to +4, your maximum Dexterity modifier decreases to +1, and your Speed decreases to 20 feet (reflected in the statistics above).

Attuned Avatar.name: Attuned Avatar
Attuned Avatar.description: You've attuned deeply with the eldamon within you, granting you the ability to process more elemental power at once. You can prepare a fifth elemental power each day, which can be active, reactive, or refresh. You learn an additional elemental power, which is cumulative with the power you learn at 5th level from your elemental power class feature.

Banhammer.name: Banhammer
Banhammer.description: Your hammer rebuffs creatures and bans them from returning. When you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} with your body unarmed attack, you can use your hammer instead. If you do, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your Athletics check to Shove. If you succeed, on the target's next turn, if it attempts to move toward you during its move action, it must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save against your power DC; on a failure, it can't move toward you during that move action. On a success, it can move toward you and doesn't need to attempt any further saving throws.

Because I Could Not Stop for Death.name: Because I Could Not Stop for Death
Because I Could Not Stop for Death.description: You can swathe yourself with death energy as you move, and when this dissuades your foes from stopping you, you gain a burst of speed. You gain the death elemental locomotion ability. During a Stride using that ability, if at least one foe chooses to allow you to move through its space, you can move 10 additional feet beyond the movement your land Speed would normally allow.

Bone Mantle.name: Bone Mantle
Bone Mantle.description: Your covered in protective bones that prevent the worst from happening. Your protective bone mantle grants you resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1) to critical hits. This resistance can't reduce the damage from a critical hit lower than the damage from a normal hit.

Brainpower.name: Brainpower
Brainpower.description: Thanks to bring a brain, when you're phased in, you can focus more easily than other eldamon on proximal threats to remember more about them. When phased in during a combat encounter, you can Recall Knowledge about the creatures you're fighting, and you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to do so. Each time you use Rush of Insight to Recall Knowledge, you can choose whether you Recall Knowledge or your mortal friend Recalls Knowledge.

Brains in a Jar.name: Brains in a Jar
Brains in a Jar.description: You multiprocesses thoughts through the brains in your jar, allowing you to fail gracefully and elude mental effects. When you fail a Will save, you can shunt the effects into your subsidiary brains in order to reroll the saving throw and take the better result; this is a fortune effect. If you do, your subsidiary brains are out of commission for 1 hour, and you can't use this ability again until then.

Breathtaker.name: Breathtaker
Breathtaker.description:
When your death power kills a foe, you're energized by their dying breath. You gain a +1 status bonus on Perception checks, saving throws, and skill checks until the end of your next turn. If you use Reap Lives on that foe while benefiting for this bonus, or if you kill a creature with Reap Lives, the status bonus increases to +2.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.6r7lJqvKO3mSeVUy]{Effect: Breathtaker}

Caduceus Flow.name: Caduceus Flow
Caduceus Flow.description:
When you help others, the overflowing life energy protects you as well. Whenever you use a life power that benefits one or more allies, but does not benefit yourself, you gain 1 temporary Hit Point until the beginning of your next turn. This increases to 2 temporary Hit Points if you're an expert in power DC, 3 temporary Hit Points if you're a master in power DC, and 4 temporary Hit Points if you're legendary in power DC.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.MGO6Kpf2LdrYdMSA]{Effect: Caduceus Flow}

Calling.name: Calling
Calling.description: Every eldamon trainer has a calling. A calling corresponds to the reason the eldamon trainer travels the land befriending eldamon, but it’s more than just a reason. Those without the incredible will and absolute certainty to see their calling through rarely manifest a connection to eldamon strong enough to allow them to share their own personal phase with an eldamon.

Camouflage.name: Camouflage
Camouflage.description: You can transform to any color necessary to blend in with your environment. You can Hide and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} even without cover or being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}.

Chromatic Ridges.name: Chromatic Ridges
Chromatic Ridges.description: Your ridges take on a coloration based on your mood, granting you resistance to a random energy type. When you phase in, or at the beginning of an encounter if you're already phased in, roll 1d8 and consult the colors and damage types from the rainbow light elemental ability. Your ridges take on the color you rolled (or the color you chose if you roll an 8), and you gain resistance equal to your level to the associated damage type. On a roll of 7, this resistance to force is cumulative with your base resistance from being a light eldamon.

Clinging Frost.name: Clinging Frost
Clinging Frost.description: The ice, frost, and snow you call forth lingers and sticks to its targets. An Interact action to reduce the value of the @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W]{Frozen} condition doesn't reduce the frozen value below 1 unless the creature is frozen 1; the creature then becomes temporarily immune to clinging frost for 1 minute.

Cloak of Snow.name: Cloak of Snow
Cloak of Snow.description: A cloak of snow along your back protects you while sliding and enhances your ability to slide. You gain a +25-foot circumstance bonus to your Speed when you use your slide ability, instead of a +15-foot circumstance bonus. You are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} by the cloak of snow while moving, and you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC while moving using your slide ability.

Compound Eyes.name: Compound Eyes
Compound Eyes.description: Your many compound eyes help you see more easily and transmit your visual data to help your allies avoid attacks. You gain darkvision and a +2 circumstance bonus to visual Perception checks. Whenever you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek}, you can Seek in two areas instead of one, and when you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.TiNDYUGlMmxzxBYU]{Search}, you Search twice as quickly. Your allies aren't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} or undetected creatures of your level or lower as long as the creatures aren't hidden or undetected to you.

Confounding Force.name: Confounding Force
Confounding Force.description:
You bait and bedevil foes with your force powers, momentarily confounding them and weakening their next attack. When you hit a foe with a power attack roll on a force power or a foe fails their saving throw against your force power, you interfere with their next attack. The next time they deal damage before the end of your next turn, they take a –2 circumstance penalty on their damage roll. This increases to a –4 circumstance penalty if you're an expert in power DCs, –6 if you're a master in power DCs, and –8 if you're legendary in power DCs.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.U6FwinBAURdsyHvQ]

Constant Bolts.name: Constant Bolts
Constant Bolts.description: As long as you're charged, your capacitors shoot off superfluous lightning bolts. Any foe that ends its turn adjacent to you takes an amount of electricity damage equal to twice your @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.Bi2aHykg6CZrQCnR]{Charged} value; this damage doesn't make it lose the shocked condition. At 15th level, this damage increases to three times your charged value.

Contingent Shroud.name: Contingent Shroud
Contingent Shroud.description: You're ready for anything with a shroud to protect you from harm. When you roll initiative, you become @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN]{Shrouded 1} until the end of your first turn in combat. This also applies if you phase into combat on the first round of combat.

Countless Spikes.name: Countless Spikes
Countless Spikes.description: Your spikes are everywhere, presenting a threat even when you aren't curled up and making your foes bleed when you are. A creature that attempts a melee unarmed Strike or a non-reach melee Strike against you (whether or not you're Curled Up and whether or not it hits you) takes @Damage[(1+(floor(@actor.level/4)))[piercing]] damage, plus 1 additional piercing damage for every 4 levels you have beyond 1st, to a maximum of 5 damage at 19th level, with a basic Reflex save against your power DC. This replaces the damage from Curl Up. However, if you're Curled Up, a creature that fails their Reflex save also takes an equal amount of @Damage[(1+(floor(@actor.level/4)))[persistent,bleed]] damage.

Courageous Sparkle.name: Courageous Sparkle
Courageous Sparkle.description: The light within you sparkles across your armor and body. Your item bonus to AC from your armor of light increases to +5. At the end of your turn when you have the frightened condition, you sparkle mightily, and the condition reduces by 2 instead of 1; if you reduce your frightened condition by 2 in this way and the creature that gave you the frightened condition is within 30 feet, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round by the sparkles.

Crimson Gullet.name: Crimson Gullet
Crimson Gullet.description: The raging water energy within you glows crimson when you're ready to use a high tide power. When you're in high tide, you add the status bonus to damage rolls from raging cycle to your unarmed jaws Strikes. Additionally, if you succeed at a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} check to grab a foe in your mouth, they take an amount of bludgeoning damage equal to that status bonus from the rampaging water energy.

Crystalline Guard.name: Crystalline Guard
Crystalline Guard.description:
Trigger Your turn ends

The many crystals throughout your body allow earth energy to flow through you easily and store within the crystals to release when needed. At the end of your turn, you can choose to deplete your energy to gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your AC until the beginning of your next turn. If you do, you can't do so again until you refresh at least three times to replenish the missing energy. Since you refresh instantly after an encounter, you can also replenish your crystalline guard swiftly.

Crystallize Life.name: Crystallize Life
Crystallize Life.description: You store crystallized life energy in golden jewels along your body. and you're phased in or when you first phase in during an encounter, you deplete some of the stored energy to gain temporary Hit Points equal to your level, which last for 1 round.

Curl Up.name: Curl Up
Curl Up.description: As a single action, you can Curl Up. If you do, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC (or increase your standard cover to greater cover if you already have standard cover) and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, can't make unarmed attacks, and can't use powers except reaction powers. A creature that hits you with a melee unarmed Strike or a non-reach melee Strike while you're curled up takes @Damage[(1+(floor(@actor.level/4)))[piercing]] damage, plus 1 additional piercing damage for every 4 levels you have beyond 1st, to a maximum of 5 damage at 19th level, with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save against your power DC. These effects last until the end of your next turn, though you can end the effect early with a single action.

Darkness Element.name: Darkness Element
Darkness Element.description:
The element of darkness represents the mystery of the unknown and the ability to shroud, obscure, and hide. While some find the darkness and the unknown terrifying and cruel, it can also be comforting, protecting from the harshness of the light. The darkness element also manipulates the shadows that form on the edges between light and darkness. Darkness eldamon and elemental avatars shroud themselves in shadows and darkness and manipulate them to keep their movements and intentions hidden.

Associated Damage Type: Cold

Associated Traits: Darkness, Shadow

Darkness Key Terms

You’ll see the following term in many darkness elemental powers.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN]{Shrouded}: Darkness powers and effects might give a creature the shrouded condition. The shrouded condition always has a value, from 1 to 3. The light surrounding a shrouded creature is occluded depending on the condition’s value and the level of light surrounding them. This affects the shrouded creature’s ability to see as well as other creatures’ ability to see the shrouded creature. Essentially the shrouded condition causes the light level to be a number of steps lower for the shrouded creature equal to the condition’s value (bright light to dim light, dim light to darkness, darkness to supernatural darkness akin to the 4th-rank darkness spell), except that shrouded 1 in dim light causes a creature to be concealed to low-light vision, rather than creating full darkness. Additionally, a creature gains a circumstance bonus on Stealth checks to Hide and Sneak equal to the shrouded condition’s value. It’s possible to Hide and Sneak while shrouded by sinking into the shadows, but in a bright area, your general position might still be obvious due to the pall of darkness, in the same way as sneaking around with a visible aura around you might still give you away; in that case, you would be hidden instead of undetected. A shrouded creature that would become limned instead loses its shrouded condition, and vice versa. For a full description of how to apply the shrouded condition for every possible value of shrouded and every possible level of lighting, see the following sidebar.

Shrouded Full Examples

If you're not sure of an interaction with the shrouded condition, the following are all possible combinations of shrouded values and light levels. The shrouded condition applies on top of the light level in the area, which could also be based on light and darkness spells and effects, but powers and abilities that grant shrouded are magical effects that have the darkness trait and can potentially be counteracted by effects with the light trait explicitly targeted against them. When it comes to light and darkness effects that don't explicitly target the source of the shrouded condition, apply all of those first to determine the true light level in the area, then use shrouded to see how well @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} the shrouded creature is and how shrouded its vision has become. If a creature and its target are both shrouded, the conditions aren't cumulative; apply only the higher valued shrouded condition's effect.

A creature that is shrouded 3 is shrouded in supernatural darkness, regardless of the light level or other light sources. If they have darkvision but not greater darkvision, everything around them is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} (and they can't see at all if they don't have darkvision), and if other creatures have darkvision but not greater darkvision, the shrouded creature is concealed (and they can't see the shrouded creature at all if they don't have darkvision).

For a creature that's shrouded 2, the same effect applies unless they are in an area of bright light, in which case they are shrouded in normal darkness and can see normally if they have darkvision and other creatures can see them normally if they have darkvision.

If the creature is only shrouded 1, the light level is one step lower (with a different effect for dim light), so in bright light, they're shrouded in dim light and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} except to creatures with low-light vision or darkvision, and everything is concealed to them unless they have low-light vision or darkvision; in dim light, the shadows deepen, causing them to be concealed except to creatures with darkvision, and everything is concealed to them unless they have darkvision; and in darkness, they're shrouded in supernatural darkness and concealed even to creatures with darkvision and everything is concealed to them even with darkvision.

Shrouding Foes

When you shroud a foe, it makes them difficult to see, in addition to making it harder for the foe to see. Think carefully about whether to choose powers that shroud foes based on whether your group has low-light vision, darkvision, and greater darkvision. At low levels, if your group doesn't have much of either, you might want to avoid the powers that shroud foes, while at higher levels, you can consider gaining darkvision options as a group (a good idea anyway) in order to take advantage of those powers.

Other Abilities

If your element is darkness, you gain the following abilities and effects from the Elemental Surge action, the Elemental Shield action, and the elemental avatar feats that vary by element.

Elemental Locomotion The shadows and darkness surround you while you move, making it easy for you to sneak around. Thanks to the darkness, you can Hide and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} even without cover or being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, though the unnatural darkness and shadows that hide you might give you away, so you take a –2 penalty to your Stealth checks to do so. If you have the Legendary Sneak skill feat (or another ability that gives you the same benefit as Legendary Sneak, such as the goblin ancestry feat Very, Very Sneaky), you no longer take the penalty and instead gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Stealth checks to Hide and Sneak.

Elemental Manipulation When you use Elemental Manipulation, you can control darkness and shadows, slightly changing their configuration or giving yourself or a willing touched ally shrouded 1 for 1 round. At your GM's discretion, you can make other small adjustments to darkness.

Elemental Resistance You become protected against darkness and shadow. You gain resistance equal to half your level against damage from darkness and shadow effects and a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against such effects. If you have Enhanced Resistances, the circumstance bonus increases to +2.

Elemental Sculptor When you use the Elemental Sculptor feat, you can move and control darkness and shadows to a greater extent than Elemental Manipulation. This allows you to twist and shape shadows like shadow puppets, adjusting their position or appearance, in up to a 10-foot by 10-foot area within 20 feet. At the GM's discretion, you can make other similar adjustments to darkness and shadows' shape or position.

Elemental Senses You gain greater darkvision, which allows you to see clearly even in areas of extreme darkness (such as from a 4th level darkness spell or shrouded 3).

Elemental Shield While your Elemental Shield is raised, the flat check to target you when you're concealed increases from 5 to 6.

Elemental Surge You or the chosen willing creature become shrouded 1 until the end of your next turn.

Enhanced Locomotion You can transport from shadow to shadow, from patch of darkness to patch of darkness. If you're in an area of dim light or darkness (the shrouded condition isn't sufficient), as a single action, which has the move and teleportation traits, you can sink into the shadows and then reappear in another space in dim light or darkness within 30 feet. You still need line of effect to the space, but you don't need to cross the intervening squares, allowing you to avoid obstacles and hazardous terrain, and this movement doesn't trigger reactions based on movement.

Dauntless.name: Dauntless
Dauntless.description: Some call you cold-blooded, others call you fearless. Either way, things others find scary you normally just find exciting. Whenever you gain the frightened condition, you reduce the frightened value by 1.

Dazzling Sparkles.name: Dazzling Sparkles
Dazzling Sparkles.description: Your light sparkles and twinkles more extensively than most, causing the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} condition to be more severe. The DC for the concealment flat check from your dazzled condition increases from 5 to 6 (or from 7 to 8 for the @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.powers.Item.ZaRLdvBeedlpgwwr]{Intensify Glare} reaction.)

Death Element.name: Death Element
Death Element.description:
The element of death represents the end of life, part of the natural cycle. Death powers represent the end, so they weaken and kill living things and undead alike. Because death powers have the death trait, they kill their targets outright, rather than leave them unconscious and alive. As undying incarnations of natural elements, eldamon aren't killed by death powers, though they're still harmed and depleted as normal for other damaging effects. This is fortunate when it comes to eldamon battles, as otherwise death eldamon would be banned from competing.

Final End: Death powers deal void damage to living creatures, draining away their life, but they deal force damage to undead instead, losing the death and void traits against undead. Even so, undead are sometimes immune to some of a death power's additional effects, such as instant death effects. Creatures neither alive nor dead, such as constructs, are beyond the reach of the death element.

Life Drain: Death powers take advantage of creatures with weakened life force, dealing more damage to those who are already drained. Whenever a death power applies the drained condition to a creature that's already drained, the drained creature takes additional void damage equal to its level multiplied by the lower of its existing drained condition and the new drained condition. For example, if a 9th-level creature with drained 2 would be drained 1 by a death power, it takes 9 additional void damage, and if a 7th-level creature with drained 2 would be drained 3 by a death power, it takes 14 additional void damage.

Associated Damage Type: Void

Associated Traits: Void

Prepare to Die!

Death eldamon and their powers can be scary for some foes, especially Inexorable Demise, with its visible countdown. Just like in any situation, the GM can choose to grant circumstance bonuses or penalties to certain types of actions taken in conjunction with death powers. For instance, it might be easier to Coerce someone with Quick Coerce if you're out of combat and they're under the effect of Inexorable Demise. As always, the GM determines when to grant these benefits.

Other Abilities

If your element is death, you gain the following abilities and effects from the Elemental Surge action, the Elemental Shield action, and the elemental avatar feats that vary by element.

Elemental Locomotion You can surround yourself with death energy as you move, forcing foes to get out of your way or suffer the consequences. As a single action, you can Stride while swathed in death energy. During this movement, you can attempt to move through a foe's space. The foe has a choice: they can either allow you to move through their space, or they can prevent your movement, taking 1 void damage plus 1 void damage for each level you have, with a basic Fortitude save. If a foe chooses to prevent your movement in this way, your movement immediately ends, even if you still had more distance you could travel.

Elemental Manipulation When you use Elemental Manipulation, you can control death in minor ways, allowing you to increase or decrease a creature's dying value by up to 2 or kill a tiny non-creature plant with just a touch. At your GM's discretion, you can make other small adjustments involving death, though this is never sufficient to kill a creature that isn't already dying.

Elemental Resistance Your body becomes resistant to death's call. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus on saving throws against death effects and gain resistance equal to half your level against void damage. If you have the Enhanced Resistance feat, your circumstance bonus against death effects increases to +2.

Elemental Sculptor When you use the Elemental Sculptor feat, you can bring to a greater extent than Elemental Manipulation. This allows you to kill noncreature plants in an area roughly one 10-foot by 10-foot square or less up to 20 feet away or to kill a dying creature. At the GM's discretion, you can make other similar adjustments involving death and killing, though it's still insufficient to kill a creature that isn't already dying.

Elemental Senses You can sense how close a creature is to death. Just by looking at a creature, you can tell if they are healthy (above 3/4 Hit Points), hurt (between half and 3/4 Hit Points), injured (between 1/4 and half Hit Points) or at death's door (below 1/4 Hit Points). A creature actively attempting to disguise its life force or level of injury can attempt a Deception check against your Perception DC as normal, but otherwise your sense works without needing to attempt a check.

Elemental Shield The shield also grants a +1 circumstance bonus to Fortitude saves.

Elemental Surge The chosen creature is enfeebled 1 or clumsy 1 (your choice) for 1 round unless they succeed at a Fortitude save against your power DC.

Enhanced Locomotion Your connection to death allows you to appear by the side of recently or nearly dead creatures, almost like a psychopomp or harbinger of doom. As a single action, which has the move trait, you can briefly transition into death energy and then reappear in a space adjacent to any creature that is dying or has died in the past minute within 60 feet. You still need line of effect to the creature and you must be able to detect them with a precise sense, but you don't need to cross the intervening squares, allowing you to avoid obstacles and hazardous terrain, and this movement doesn't trigger reactions based on movement.

Deep Accumulation.name: Deep Accumulation
Deep Accumulation.description: When your ice powers accumulate the @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W] condition on a creature, the maximum value for the frozen condition increases by 2 (starting at 7, to a maximum of 12 at 20th level).

Deep Burns.name: Deep Burns
Deep Burns.description: The undying flame in your tail empowers your burning attacks. You gain a +2 status bonus to persistent fire damage you deal with your powers.

Defensive Quills.name: Defensive Quills
Defensive Quills.description: A creature that hits you with a melee unarmed Strike or a non-reach melee Strike takes @Damage[(max(@actor.level/2,1))[piercing]] damage equal to half your level (minimum 1), with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save against your power DC.

Double Senses.name: Double Senses
Double Senses.description: Even when it isn't visible, your life force duplicate assists your senses. You're an expert in Perception, and at 9th level, you become a master in Perception.

Dragon Soul.name: Dragon Soul
Dragon Soul.description: Your confidence surges, granting you the soul of a dragon to dispel your fears. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against fear effects. When you roll a success at a Will save against a fear effect, you get a critical success instead. In addition, anytime you gain the frightened condition, reduce its value by 1.

Drink Breath.name: Drink Breath
Drink Breath.description: You drink the last breath of a dying foe when you're nearby. If a foe dies within 5 feet of you, or if you move within 5 feet of a foe who died in the last round, you can steal their last breath as a free action. If you do, you gain [[/r max(@actor.level,1)]] temporary Hit Points equal to your level, which last for 1 round.

Dry Bones.name: Dry Bones
Dry Bones.description: Your skeletal form protects you from various forms of harm. You gain resistance 5 against cold, electricity, fire, piercing, and slashing.

Earth Element.name: Earth Element
Earth Element.description:
The element of earth represents the strength and endurance of rock and stone. Thus, its powers tend to have a shorter range but focus on allowing their user to endure various attacks and come out on top.

Associated Damage Type: Bludgeoning

Associated Traits: Earth

Other Abilities

If your element is earth, you gain the following abilities and effects from the Elemental Surge action (page 70), the Elemental Shield action (page 57), and the elemental avatar feats that vary by element.

Elemental Locomotion You can climb up rock, stone, and earthen surfaces. You gain a climb Speed equal to half your land Speed, which you can use on any rock or earthen surface.

Elemental Manipulation When you use Elemental Manipulation, you can move stone and earthen objects, or churn through earth in minor ways, allowing you to till soil, drag a stone object of up to 8 Bulk up to 15 feet, and so on. At your GM’s discretion, you can make other small adjustments to earth or rock.

Elemental Resistance Your body’s connection to the earth allows you to resist movement as long as you’re standing on solid ground. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your Fortitude or Reflex DC against attempts to Shove or Trip you as long as you are standing on a solid surface. This bonus also applies to saving throws against spells or effects that attempt to knock you prone. In addition, if any effect would force you to move 10 feet or more while you’re standing on a solid surface, you are moved only half the distance. If you have the Enhanced Resistance feat, the circumstance bonus increases to +4.

Elemental Sculptor When you use the Elemental Sculptor feat, you can shape and sculpt loose earth into a desired shape. A single use of Elemental Sculptor doesn’t create something solid enough to stand up to force or artistic enough to sell off aesthetic merit, though repeated application over a long period of time might allow you to Craft something using Elemental Sculptor. The earthen sculpture must be small enough to fit in a single 10-foot by 10-foot square or less, and you can sculpt earth up to 20 feet away. At the GM’s discretion, you can make other similar adjustments to earth’s shape or position.

Elemental Senses You can sense anything else in contact with the same surface via tremors. You gain tremorsense as an imprecise sense out to 30 feet.

Elemental Shield The first time you take physical damage after using Elemental Shield, if the damage isn’t adamantine, reduce the damage by half your level (minimum 1).

Elemental Surge You gain resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1) to physical damage (except adamantine) for 1 round.

Enhanced Locomotion You can burrow into the earth. You gain a burrow Speed equal to half your land Speed or 20 feet, whichever is less. You can use this burrow Speed to burrow through soft earth but not solid rock, as normal for a burrow Speed.

Earth's Vengeance.name: Earth's Vengeance
Earth's Vengeance.description: Creatures who damage you find quick comeuppance. After a creature damages you, when your earth powers damage that creatures, you gain a +1 status bonus to the power's damage for 24 hours. This increases to +2 if you're an expert in power DC, +3 if you're a master in power DC, and +4 if you're legendary in power DC. If the earth power deals damage in direct response to a creature's attacks against you (such as @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.powers.Item.T5oNn3SpWhfIplFn]{Rebounding Embrace} or @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.powers.Item.PGWQoYE0blIBmHP6]{Vengeful Backlash}), the status bonus to damage increases by 2 (to a maximum of +6 if you're legendary in power DC).

Eldamon.name: Eldamon
Eldamon.description: This eldamon class item is added automatically to eldamon when adding the ancestry.

Eldamon Battler.name: Eldamon Battler
Eldamon Battler.description:
Victory in battle is the most important thing to you, and to that end, you want to recruit the strongest possible team of eldamon who are willing to help you fight your way to the top. Everything else is a means to that end for you, but that doesn't mean you don't care just as deeply for your eldamon as trainers of other callings. You train with them every day, working to help them actualize their goals and reach their hidden potential. You can't be the very best if you try to do everything on your own—you can only achieve victory together!

All of your eldamon gain the @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.actions.Item.g8lH9enxTY6Cpx9V]{Elemental Shield} action and increase their maximum Hit Points by an amount equal to your level (minimum 2). When your eldamon use the Elemental Shield action, it gains their element's associated trait or traits.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.oIzIs2KhbE9q9QW8]{Calling: Eldamon Battler}

Eldamon Evolution.name: Eldamon Evolution
Eldamon Evolution.description:
You've hit a major breakthrough in training your eldamon, allowing you to help them evolve. Each eldamon has evolution conditions, and if you meet them, the eldamon gains a new evolved battle form. This evolved form gains increased proficiencies, an attribute boost to the eldamon's three highest attributes, and a new special ability.

Your eldamon also gain several other proficiencies and abilities at 11th level, although it does so even if you don't have this class feature.

By working hard with your eldamon, you have come to understand your own limits as well. This allows you to prepare to phase five eldamon each day, instead of four, as long as your key attribute modifier is at least +5.

Eldamon Expert.name: Eldamon Expert
Eldamon Expert.description: Having traveled across the region, searching all around, the eldamon you know are legion with the knowledge that you've found. Your proficiency rank for eldamon trainer class DCs increases to expert.

Eldamon Master.name: Eldamon Master
Eldamon Master.description: When it comes to eldamon trainers, you're among the very best and earned a great deal of fame. Befriending eldamon is truly your quest, and training them is your aim. Your proficiency rank for eldamon trainer class DCs increases to master.

Eldamon Powers.name: Eldamon Powers
Eldamon Powers.description:
Your eldamon are capable of incredible powers based on their element. Powers, also known as elemental powers, are a special type of magical ability, different from spells. When phased into reality, eldamon can use their powers to battle your foes. Once an eldamon uses a power, they normally can't use that power again until they use a refresh power (though that limit doesn't apply to refresh powers themselves), or until they phase back out, whichever comes first. Powers have separate proficiencies for attacks and DCs, which aren't the same as spells, class DCs, or weapon or unarmed proficiencies. Your eldamon share several types of item bonus with you if they come from invested items. An eldamon's power DC and power attack modifiers are based on their key attribute, Wisdom.

When you first befriend an eldamon, they typically know the powers listed for that eldamon at that level, though you might find an eldamon with different powers.

At 3rd level, 5th level, 7th level, 9th level, 11th level, 13th level, 15th level, and 17th level, your eldamon can replace one of their elemental powers with a new elemental power, which must be of their level or lower. It's simplest and saves a lot of time if you befriend numerous eldamon to use the suggested progression listed for that eldamon, but since you're training them, you can work together with them to learn whichever power you wish. At 19th level, they instead learn an ultimate power (see the ultimate power class feature for more details).

Eldamon Researcher.name: Eldamon Researcher
Eldamon Researcher.description:
Eldamon are endlessly fascinating creatures, distinct from mortals, constructs, undead, and even other extraplanar creatures. They embody a cross-section of reality that mortal ancestries can rarely see or access, at least under normal conditions, and thus they represent a unique opportunity to understand the metaphysical underpinnings of the cosmos! For this and many other reasons, countless researchers have become obsessed with studying every aspect of eldamon, and you are among their esteemed number.

You can choose Intelligence as your key attribute. You're trained in Nature. You can use your Intelligence modifier, instead of your Wisdom modifier, to roll Nature checks to Recall Knowledge. You can always roll Nature for initiative against eldamon and elementals, using your Intelligence modifier instead of your Wisdom modifier if you prefer, and you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Nature checks to Recall Knowledge about eldamon and elementals and on initiative rolls against eldamon and elementals. Furthermore, your deep knowledge about eldamon and elementals grants you a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks and saving throws against eldamon and elementals. Finally, you gain the I Know This! Action.

Eldamon Whisperer.name: Eldamon Whisperer
Eldamon Whisperer.description:
You feel a deeper connection to eldamon than anyone else you've met. Whether you find them adorable, majestic, or mysterious, they've always made a huge impression on you, and something inside you told you that your destiny was entwined with eldamon. For their part, eldamon have always reacted well to you, even compared to other eldamon trainers.

You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Diplomacy checks to Make an Impression on an eldamon, Make a Request of an eldamon, or use your elemental assistance class feature. You also gain the +2 circumstance bonus to all other skill checks made to build your relationship with your eldamon or to directly interact with your eldamon to reach an evolution threshold, though this doesn't apply to any checks you make during your adventures to help reach an evolution threshold; for example, if you needed to tell your eldamon a ghost story, the bonus would apply to the check you make to tell the ghost story, but if you needed to find valuable treasure or defeat a powerful enemy in battle, the circumstance bonus wouldn't apply to your checks to do so.

Additionally, whenever you meet an eldamon in a non-hostile environment, including as a typical meeting after defeating a creature it was inhabiting or finding an item it was inhabiting, you can immediately attempt a Diplomacy check to Make an Impression on that eldamon rather than needing to converse for 1 minute. You take a –5 penalty to the check. If you fail, you can engage in 1 minute of conversation and attempt a new check at the end of that time rather than accepting the failure or critical failure result. If you have the Glad-Hand skill feat, you don't take the penalty on your check if the target is an eldamon.

Finally, you gain the @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.actions.Item.JRM2xldo9FdB1NDT]{You Can Do It!} Action.

Electricity Element.name: Electricity Element
Electricity Element.description:
The element of electricity represents the charging flow and overwhelming shocks of lightning and other electricity. Electric eldamon and elemental avatars build up charge in order to launch extremely powerful attacks.

Associated Damage Type: Electricity

Associated Traits: Electricity

Electricity Key Terms

You'll see the following terms in almost every electricity elemental power.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.Bi2aHykg6CZrQCnR]{Charged}: Electricity eldamon and electricity elemental avatars can gain the charged condition. The charged condition always has a value, from 1 to 3. If a charged creature is already charged and would become charged, they instead increase the value of their charged condition by 1 to a maximum of charged 3. A charged creature is shocked as long as it is charged. Any effect that would remove the shocked condition instead reduces the charged condition value by 1. Most electricity powers offer options to discharge, reducing the charged condition by 1, in order to gain additional effects. The charged condition lasts until the end of an encounter; any charge gained outside an encounter is lost during the next refresh. As a result, electricity eldamon and elemental avatars always begin an encounter uncharged. An electricity eldamon or elemental avatar can't use a power (or an optional benefit within a power) that requires them to discharge if they aren't charged.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.1fZbuJEbVmE3J4XL]{Shocked}: The shocked condition normally doesn't have a value. A shocked creature is electrically charged, making it easy for electricity to harm it. It's off-guard against attacks that deal electricity damage (even if it's only additional electricity damage, such as a shock weapon) and takes –2 circumstance penalty on Fortitude and Reflex saving throws against electricity effects. The shocked condition normally lasts for the duration listed, but it ends early if the creature takes any amount of electricity damage from a source other than persistent electricity damage, or if they spend an Interact action to discharge the electricity harmlessly

Other Abilities

If your element is electricity, you gain the following abilities and effects from the Elemental Surge action, the Elemental Shield action, and the elemental avatar feats that vary by element.

Elemental Locomotion You can jolt off like a bolt of lightning almost instantly, as a single action, which has the move trait, starting from a solid surface. This allows you to move in a straight line in any direction (even vertically), at a distance out to half your land Speed, without triggering reactions based on movement. If your destination contains an object or creature of significant size that substantially conducts electricity (such as copper, silver, or gold), you can move up to your land Speed instead of half your land Speed. If you end the movement somewhere that can't support your weight, such as in mid-air, you fall.

Elemental Manipulation When you use Elemental Manipulation, you can control electricity and electric current, diverting electric currents or electric charge. You can also give an adjacent creature the shocked condition for 2 rounds. At your GM's discretion, you can make other small adjustments to electricity.

Elemental Resistance Your body becomes protected against electric surges, as the energy within you diverts hostile electricity. Environmental electricity effects never strike you by chance, though this doesn't protect you from electric attacks or magically controlled weather. You gain resistance equal to half your level against electricity damage.

Elemental Sculptor When you use the Elemental Sculptor feat, you can move and control electricity to a greater extent than Elemental Manipulation. This allows you to channel significant electric current and even direct nearby environmental electricity to another target of your choice. For instance, if a lightning bolt from a thunderstorm (not a spell, power, or other ability) was about to hit a tree, you could divert it to a nearby foe instead. At the GM's discretion, you can make other similar adjustments to electricity's shape or position.

Elemental Senses You gain imprecise voltsense out to 30 feet, which allows you to sense electric potential and currents. Not only does it allow you to notice electric power moving around you, it can potentially allow you to notice most living creatures, as they rely on electric currents to power their nervous systems. However, the electric current from a living creature is quite small and easily hidden amidst the various currents in the environment, even if a creature isn't taking precautions against voltsense. Stronger electricity, on the other hand, is almost impossible to hide from you.

Elemental Shield If a foe misses their melee attack only because of the Elemental Shield's circumstance bonus to AC, the shield zaps the foe, and they become shocked until the end of your next turn.

Elemental Surge The chosen creature becomes shocked until the end of your next turn unless they succeed at a Reflex save against your power DC.

Enhanced Locomotion You can chain the lightning jolts from your elemental locomotion zigzagging through conductive materials like chain lightning. As long as you continue using lightning jolts to move at least once per turn, you don't fall until the end of your next turn, even if you end your movement in mid-air. Unlike a fly Speed, you can move straight up without counting the movement as difficult terrain, and you continue ignoring reactions based on movement with your lightning jolts, but you can still only move in a series of straight lines.

Element.name: Element
Element.description: You gain the power of an element depending on the eldamon you embody as an elemental avatar. You likely gain one or more mild physical features related to your element, the eldamon within you, or both. Additionally, choose a common, uncommon, or rare eldamon of your element to embody (see @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.journals.JournalEntry.SUEJ4rJaCs7WNc2B]{Chapter 4: Eldamon Entries}). You gain the elemental ability of that eldamon.

Elemental Assistance.name: Elemental Assistance
Elemental Assistance.description: During exploration, you phase in eldamon to use their elemental powers in order to assist your allies. You can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Aid} one of your allies’ skill checks during exploration using Diplomacy to determine the result of your Aid as you encourage your eldamon to assist with their elemental powers. To do so, describe how the eldamon’s elemental abilities assist your ally’s check.

Elemental Attack Expertise.name: Elemental Attack Expertise
Elemental Attack Expertise.description: You learn to aim your element powers carefully, striking your foes with pinpoint accuracy. Your proficiency rank for attack rolls with elemental powers of your element increases to expert.

Elemental Attack Mastery.name: Elemental Attack Mastery
Elemental Attack Mastery.description: You attune yourself deeply to your element, allowing you to aim your elemental powers with mystical and almost instinctual precision. Your proficiency rank for attack rolls with elemental powers of your element increases to master.

Elemental Defense.name: Elemental Defense
Elemental Defense.description:
Eldamon TrainerYou use the power of your eldamon, combined with your own defensive movements, to enhance your protection. Your proficiency ranks for light armor and unarmored defense increase to expert.

Elemental AvatarYou use the power of your element, combined with your own defensive movements, to enhance your protection. Your proficiency ranks for light armor and unarmored defense increase to expert.

Elemental Duality.name: Elemental Duality
Elemental Duality.description: You etch multiple paths of elemental power into your life force, mind, body, and soul, allowing you to choose between two sets of powers. Whenever you prepare your elemental powers, prepare two sets of powers instead of one, though only one is available to you at a time. At the beginning of your first turn in an encounter, and whenever you refresh, choose which of the two sets of powers are available to you. You can only use powers from the set you chose.

Elemental Effusion.name: Elemental Effusion
Elemental Effusion.description:
Elemental energy tends to pool and gather around you over time as it remains unused, waiting to spill out when first released. Just before you phase in your first eldamon during an encounter, as you alter your phase, elemental energy that matches the eldamon you intend to phase in spills out from you whether you want it to or not. You can direct that energy to manifest into a small elemental assault at a foe to deal minor damage and test the foe's resistances. Just before you phase in your first eldamon during a battle, choose a foe within 60 feet and choose an associated damage type of the eldamon you intend to phase in. The foe must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|against:eldamon-trainer] save against your class DC with the following effects. You can spend a single action on your Phase Eldamon to switch the eldamon you're phasing in to a different eldamon based on the information you learned from the effusion.

Critical Success The foe avoids the effusion entirely and doesn't take any damage, and you know they critically succeeded and that the effusion didn't give you any information.

Success The effusion deals @Damage[1[untyped]] damage of the associated type to the foe, which also has the associated traits of the eldamon's element. You know whether or not this damage applied to the foe, which could help you determine whether they might have resistance or immunity to that damage type.

Failure As success, but you deal @Damage[2[untyped]] damage.

Critical Failure As success, but you deal @Damage[4[untyped]] damage.

Elemental Fortitude.name: Elemental Fortitude
Elemental Fortitude.description: Your body is in tune with the eldamon within, causing you to grow hardy. Your proficiency rank for Fortitude saves increases to master. When you roll a success on a Fortitude save, you get a critical success instead.

Elemental Manipulation.name: Elemental Manipulation
Elemental Manipulation.description: Drawing upon the elemental energies within you, you can manipulate the elements around you, as a two-action activity, which has the concentrate trait, the magical trait, and your element's associated trait or traits. This allows you to produce the elemental manipulation effect listed in your element.

Elemental Powers.name: Elemental Powers
Elemental Powers.description:
The eldamon within you grants you incredible powers based on your element. Powers, also known as elemental powers, are a special type of magical ability, different from spells. As an elemental avatar, you use powers to battle your foes. Once you use a power, you normally can't use that power again until you Refresh (see @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.journals.JournalEntry.QsiJY2HP4WuA7Ntt.JournalEntryPage.eRfWb2pyr5IQMdrf#using-and-refreshing-powers]{Using and Refreshing Powers}) to replenish your powers, though that limit doesn't apply to refresh powers. Powers have separate proficiencies for attacks and DCs, which aren't the same as spells, class DCs, or weapon or unarmed proficiencies. However, you can use your power DC in place of your class DC for abilities based on your class DC, if it's higher. As an elemental avatar, you add the item bonus to attack rolls from handwraps of mighty blows to your attack rolls with elemental powers, though striking runes and property runes have no effect. You can also choose to Invest a magic weapon in order to add the item bonus to attack rolls from the weapon's potency rune to your power attack rolls instead. Your power DC and power attack modifier are based on your key attribute, Wisdom.

As a new elemental avatar, you learn one 1st level reactive power, one 1st level refresh power, and two other 1st level powers. All elemental powers you learn, from this feature or elsewhere, must be powers from your element, or universal powers. Each day during your daily preparations, you can choose four powers to prepare; one must be a reactive power, one must be a refresh power, and the other two can be any type of power (active, reactive, or refresh), though most elemental avatars choose active powers so that they can go longer without refreshing. When you're just starting out, you only know four powers, so you'll pick those same powers each day, but you learn more powers as you increase in level.

At 3rd level, 5th level, 7th level, 9th level, 11th level, 13th level, 15th level, and 17th level, you learn one additional elemental power, which must be of your level or lower. At 19th level, you instead learn an ultimate power (see the ultimate power class feature for more details).

Elemental Powers (11th).name: Elemental Powers (11th)
Elemental Powers (11th).description: You learn one additional elemental power, which must be of your level or lower.

Elemental Powers (13th).name: Elemental Powers (13th)
Elemental Powers (13th).description: You learn one additional elemental power, which must be of your level or lower.

Elemental Powers (15th).name: Elemental Powers (15th)
Elemental Powers (15th).description: You learn one additional elemental power, which must be of your level or lower.

Elemental Powers (17th).name: Elemental Powers (17th)
Elemental Powers (17th).description: You learn one additional elemental power, which must be of your level or lower.

Elemental Powers (3rd).name: Elemental Powers (3rd)
Elemental Powers (3rd).description: You learn one additional elemental power, which must be of your level or lower.

Elemental Powers (5th).name: Elemental Powers (5th)
Elemental Powers (5th).description: You learn one additional elemental power, which must be of your level or lower.

Elemental Powers (7th).name: Elemental Powers (7th)
Elemental Powers (7th).description: You learn one additional elemental power, which must be of your level or lower.

Elemental Powers (9th).name: Elemental Powers (9th)
Elemental Powers (9th).description: You learn one additional elemental power, which must be of your level or lower.

Elemental Resistances and Weaknesses.name: Elemental Resistances and Weaknesses
Elemental Resistances and Weaknesses.description: The eldamon has resistances and weaknesses to the listed damage types and traits equal to their level. The resistance and weakness are based on their element, so it will rarely vary between eldamon of the same element.

Elemental Shield.name: Elemental Shield
Elemental Shield.description: You can call forth your element to protect you from harm. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.actions.Item.g8lH9enxTY6Cpx9V]{Elemental Shield} action. When you use Elemental Shield, it gains your element's associated trait or traits. When you use Elemental Shield, you can increase the circumstance bonus from Elemental Shield to +2 if you choose to hold the elemental shield in a free hand.

Energy Flower.name: Energy Flower
Energy Flower.description: You travel entwined around a flower filled with wood energy (or use your three heads for the same effect if you're in your evolved form). This is a sowed plant in your own space that moves with you and doesn't impair your movement. When you first enter battle form or evolved form, the flower is energized, allowing you to harvest it. Once harvested, the flower doesn't visually disappear, but it loses its energy until the next time you enter battle or evolved form.

Entwined Avatar.name: Entwined Avatar
Entwined Avatar.description: You've become so entwined with the eldamon within that your symbiotic power exceeds what the eldamon can produce on its own. You can prepare a sixth elemental power each day, which can be active, reactive, or refresh. You learn an additional elemental power, which is cumulative with the power you learn at 11th level from your elemental power class feature.

Enveloping Air.name: Enveloping Air
Enveloping Air.description: You call upon the essence of air to increase the area of your air powers. You can choose for your air powers with a line area to increase their length by up to 10 feet (for instance, a @Template[type:line|distance:20] to a @Template[type:line|distance:30]), and your air powers with cone, burst, and emanation areas to increase their length or radius by 5 feet (for instance, a @Template[type:cone|distance:25] to a @Template[type:cone|distance:30]). If you're a master in power DC, these improve to 20 feet of length for lines and 10 feet of length or radius for cones, bursts, and emanations.

Expert Elemental Potency.name: Expert Elemental Potency
Expert Elemental Potency.description: As you attune to the power of the eldamon within your soul, your elemental power increases. Your proficiency rank for elemental power DCs of your element increases to expert.

Exploit Frailty.name: Exploit Frailty
Exploit Frailty.description:
Your death powers are more dangerous against infirm creatures. Your death powers that cause the clumsy and enfeebled condition for 1 round cause those conditions to last until the end of your next turn instead.

You gain a status bonus to damage with your death powers equal to the highest of a creature's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7], or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18] value they received from your death powers, to a maximum of +2. If you're an expert in power DCs, the maximum status bonus to damage with your death powers is +4. If you're a master, the status bonus increases by 1 as long as a creature has at least one of the listed four conditions at any value, to a total maximum of +5, and if you're legendary, the status bonus increases by a total of 2 as long as a creature has at least one of the listed four conditions at any value, to a total maximum of +6.

Exploit Lapse.name: Exploit Lapse
Exploit Lapse.description: Your mind powers deal more damage to creatures whose mind is vulnerable due to being befuddled or afraid. You gain a status bonus to damage with your mind powers equal to the highest of a creature's stupefied value from any source or their frightened value they received from your mind powers, your @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize}, or your mortal friend's Demoralize if you're an eldamon, to a maximum of +2. If you're an expert in power DCs, the maximum status bonus to damage with your mind powers is +3. If you're a master, the status bonus increases by 1 as long as a creature is either frightened or stupefied at any value, to a total maximum of +5, and if you're legendary, the status bonus increases by a total of 2 as long as a creature is frightened or stupefied at any value, to a total maximum of +6.

Eyes of the Unseen.name: Eyes of the Unseen
Eyes of the Unseen.description: You constantly gain the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.jwK43yKsHTkJQvQ9]{See the Unseen} spell.

Eyes on the Back of Your Wheel.name: Eyes on the Back of Your Wheel
Eyes on the Back of Your Wheel.description: Thanks to your many eyes, you aren't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to flanking creatures of your level or lower. However, they can still help their allies flank.

Fire Element.name: Fire Element
Fire Element.description:
The element of fire represents the allconsuming might of flame. Thus, it's centered around powers that deal high damage along with persistent fire damage. Of all the elements, fire does the most raw damage, allowing fire eldamon and elemental avatar to turn their foes to ash.

Double Burn: When your foes are covered in your fire, you can push that fire to burn them more. Whenever a fire power or surge deals persistent fire damage to a creature that already has equal or more persistent fire damage from your fire powers or surges, you instead deal fire damage equal to the new persistent fire damage. If the effect that caused the new persistent fire damage also deals fire damage, add the damage from double burn together before applying weaknesses, resistances, and the like.

Associated Damage Type: Fire

Associated Traits: Fire

Other Abilities

If your element is fire, you gain the following abilities and effects from the Elemental Surge action (page 70), the Elemental Shield action, and the elemental avatar feats that vary by element.

Elemental Locomotion You can shoot off a jet of flame from your body as a single action, which has the move trait, to make a fire jump, as long as you are on a solid surface. This allows you to move in a straight line in any direction (even vertically), at a distance out to your land Speed. If you end the movement somewhere that can't support your weight, such as in mid-air, you can take a single additional action that doesn't have the move trait, or use a single active fire power, before falling.

Elemental Manipulation When you use Elemental Manipulation, you can call and control flames in minor ways, allowing you to create small sparks from your fingers that can ignite flammable objects, move very small flames, or put out candles and other extremely small fires by touch. At your GM's discretion, you can make other small adjustments to fires.

Elemental Resistance Your body becomes inured to flames and heat. You are protected from severe environmental heat and gain resistance equal to half your level against fire damage. If you have the Enhanced Resistance feat, you also become protected against extreme environmental heat.

Elemental Sculptor When you use the Elemental Sculptor feat, you can move and control flames to a greater extent than Elemental Manipulation. This allows you to move a fire with at most a 10-foot by 10-foot square area up to 20 feet away, or to sculpt the shape of a fire to change its aesthetic appearance, such as making the flames seem to take the shape of a dragon. At the GM's discretion, you can make other similar adjustments to a fire's shape or position.

Elemental Senses Flames, smoke, and their various aftereffects provide no impediment to your vision. You can see through fire, smoke, and heat haze. They don't impair your vision, and creatures who would be concealed only due to fire, smoke, or heat haze aren't concealed to you.

Elemental Shield If a foe misses their melee attack against you only because of the Elemental Shield's circumstance bonus to AC, the shield burns the foe, and they take fire damage equal to half your level (minimum 1).

Elemental Surge The chosen creature takes persistent fire damage equal to half your level (minimum 1) with a basic Reflex save against your power DC. If they already have persistent fire damage, they instead take fire damage equal to half your level with a basic Reflex save against your power DC.

Enhanced Locomotion You can continue shooting jets of flame in order to fly. You gain a fly Speed equal to your land Speed, but while flying in this way, you can't use the single action from elemental locomotion to make a fire jump.

Firepower.name: Firepower
Firepower.description: Your fire powers burn brighter than others. You gain a +1 status bonus to fire damage with fire powers; this increases to +2 if you're an expert in power DCs, +3 if you're a master in power DCs, and +4 if you're legendary in power DCs. As normal, this applies only to fire damage from the elemental power itself, not to persistent fire damage.

Firesight.name: Firesight
Firesight.description: You gain the smokesight ability, and you can sense fires and creatures and effects with the fire trait as an imprecise sense within 60 feet.

Flutter Jump.name: Flutter Jump
Flutter Jump.description: Your wings might not be enough to fly, but they help you jump farther. You can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2HJ4yuEFY1Cast4h]{High Jump} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.JUvAvruz7yRQXfz2]{Long Jump} as a single action without a running start, and the distance is doubled (though this still doesn't allow you to jump farther than your Speed).

Focused Training: Brawny Eldamon.name: Focused Training: Brawny Eldamon
Focused Training: Brawny Eldamon.description:

You train your eldamon friends to broaden their capacity for various skills. For each of your eldamon friends, choose for them to become brawny, burglarious, enthralling, nimble, self-sufficient, sneaky, or terrifying. If your eldamon already has the skill associated with the focused training you chose, your eldamon gains one of the skills associated with another focused training as an eldamon skill instead. Like their other eldamon skills, your eldamon become trained in the skill gained from focused training, and the skill increases to expert at 5th level and then to master at 11th level.

  • Brawny: Your eldamon is particularly brawny compared to others of their type. They gain Athletics as an eldamon skill and the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.KxaYlC50zzHysJj8]{Titan Wrestler} skill feat.

Force Element.name: Force Element
Force Element.description:
The element of force embodies a mystical metaphysical force that can move or blast things even at a distance. Thus, it focuses on powers that move other creatures around the battlefield, taking advantage of positioning to throw off your foes' rhythm.

Associated Damage Type: Force

Associated Traits: Force

Other Abilities

If your element is force, you gain the following abilities and effects from the Elemental Surge action, the Elemental Shield action, and the elemental avatar feats that vary by element.

Elemental Locomotion You use your power over force to move yourself through the air, as a single action, which has the move trait. This allows you to move in a straight line in any direction (even vertically), at a distance out to your land Speed, as long as you start on a solid surface. If you end the movement somewhere that can't support your weight, such as in mid-air, you can take a single additional action that doesn't have the move trait or use a single force power, before falling.

Elemental Manipulation When you use Elemental Manipulation, you can use force to move an object of 1 Bulk or less and within 20 feet up to 20 feet. This just moves an object from one place to another, it doesn't perform manipulate or Interact actions or the like.

Elemental Resistance Your body becomes accustomed to supernatural force. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus on saving throws against force effects and gain resistance equal to half your level against force damage. If you have the Enhanced Resistance feat, your circumstance bonus on saving throws against force effects increases to +2.

Elemental Sculptor When you use the Elemental Sculptor feat, you can sculpt force in order to move an object up to 40 Bulk up to 20 feet away and taking up no larger than a 10-foot by 10-foot by 10-foot space up to 20 feet. This just moves an object from one place to another, it doesn't perform manipulate or Interact actions or the like.

Elemental Senses You project a field of force sensors to detect nearby movement. You gain motionsense as an imprecise sense out to 30 feet.

Elemental Shield If a foe misses their melee attack only because of the Elemental Shield's circumstance bonus to AC, the shield's forces disrupt the foe's defenses momentarily, and they become off-guard against the next attack made against them before the end of your next turn.

Elemental Surge You can reposition the chosen creature 5 feet unless they succeed at a Fortitude save against your power DC.

Enhanced Locomotion You can propel yourself with force so easily that you might as well be flying. You gain a fly Speed equal to your land Speed, but while flying in this way, you can't use the single action from elemental locomotion to propel yourself with force.

Force Hands.name: Force Hands
Force Hands.description:
Your tiny arms can't do much on their own, but you keep force hands of aether manifested whenever you desire, and those pack quite a punch. When you use Athletics to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip}, you can use your giant force hands to assist you. If you do, you use your Intelligence modifier instead of your Strength modifier, and you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your Athletics check. When you use a force power that doesn't deal force damage, you can attempt a Deception check against the higher of an observer's Perception, Nature, or Occultism DC to trick them into thinking you are using a mind power instead of a force power.

@Check[type:deception|defense:perception]{Deception (Perception DC)}

@Check[type:deception|defense:nature]{Deception (Nature DC)}

@Check[type:deception|defense:occultism]{Deception (Occultism DC)}

Fortitude Expertise.name: Fortitude Expertise
Fortitude Expertise.description: Your physique is incredibly hardy. Your proficiency rank for Fortitude saves increases to expert.

Foxforce.name: Foxforce
Foxforce.description: Your dancing wisps of fox force briefly reveal @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} creatures similarly to faerie fire. When you hit a creature with a power attack roll with a force power and it takes force damage, or a creature fails its saving throw against your force power and it takes force damage, if the creature was @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} instead, and if it was visible, it can't be concealed. This effect lasts until the end of your next turn.

Frozen Soul.name: Frozen Soul
Frozen Soul.description: You cling to consciousness when necessary to protect what matters to you. When you are dropped to 0 Hit Points by damage, you remain at 1 Hit Point instead. Afterward, you can't benefit from frozen soul for 1 hour.

Garland of Salvation.name: Garland of Salvation
Garland of Salvation.description: Your garland commemorates those you have saved, and it empowers you whenever you sacrifice yourself for others. After taking damage to protect another from harm or losing Hit Points to protect another from harm (such as from your scapegoat ability), you gain a +1 status bonus to AC and saving throws until the end of your next turn.

Gecko Tongue.name: Gecko Tongue
Gecko Tongue.description: Your tongue is especially long, with a reach of 10 feet. You can use your tongue to make limited manipulate actions from a distance that don't require fingers or significant manual dexterity (such as opening a door) or to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} a creature.

Ghost Sniffer.name: Ghost Sniffer
