Ghost Sniffer.description: You have scent as an imprecise sense out to 30 feet (halved and doubled as normal for scent when smelling upwind or downwind), except the scent can only smell ghosts, spirits, haunts, and other incorporeal creatures. If the creature is incorporeal and fully within a solid object, ghost sniffer doesn't notice them unless you actively sniffs the object while within the same or an adjacent square, which requires a single action.

Glowing Tail.name: Glowing Tail
Glowing Tail.description: The glowing light energy stored in your tail allows you to combine your powers with a surge. While your tail is glowing, you can put your tail's glow out in order to use an elemental surge and an elemental power in the same turn, ignoring the usual restrictions that prevent you from using both in the same turn. Afterward, it takes 10 minutes before the gathering light energy restores the glow within your tail.

Grappling Arms.name: Grappling Arms
Grappling Arms.description: Your many arms can easily grapple foes, even after using power attacks. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Athletics checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple}, and your Athletics checks to Grapple don't apply the multiple attack penalty from powers with the attack trait (they still apply other multiple attack penalties, and they still increase your multiple attack penalty). If you're in your evolved form, the circumstance bonus to Athletics checks to Grapple increases to +2.

Greater Trainer's Heart.name: Greater Trainer's Heart
Greater Trainer's Heart.description: Your bonds with your eldamon friends reach a new level. Your proficiency rank for Will saves increases to legendary. When you roll a success on a Will save, you get a critical success. When you roll a critical failure on a Will save, you get a failure instead. When you roll a failure on a Will save against a damaging effect, you take half damage.

Green Thumb.name: Green Thumb
Green Thumb.description: When you sow plants, you sow more. Any time you sow with a power, sow in a square adjacent to the area where you already sowed. If you're an expert in power DC, you sow in two additional adjacent squares, if you're a master in power DC, you sow in three additional adjacent squares, and if you're legendary in power DC, you sow in four additional adjacent squares.

Handwraps of Mighty Blows (Eldamon).name: Handwraps of Mighty Blows (Eldamon)
Handwraps of Mighty Blows (Eldamon).description:
As you invest these embroidered strips of cloth, you must meditate and slowly wrap them around your hands. These handwraps have weapon runes etched into them to give your unarmed attacks the benefits of those runes, making your unarmed attacks work like magic weapons. For example, +1 striking handwraps of mighty blows would give you a +1 item bonus to attack rolls with your unarmed attacks and increase the damage of your unarmed attacks from one weapon die to two (normally 2d4 instead of 1d4, but if your fists have a different weapon damage die or you have other unarmed attacks, use two of that die size instead).

You can upgrade, add, and transfer runes to and from the handwraps just as you would for a weapon, and you can attach talismans to the handwraps. Treat the handwraps as melee weapons of the brawling group with light Bulk for these purposes. Property runes apply only when they would be applicable to the unarmed attack you're using. For example, a property that must be applied to a slashing weapon wouldn't function when you attacked with a fist, but you would gain its benefits if you attacked with a claw or some other slashing unarmed attack.

Handy Eyes.name: Handy Eyes
Handy Eyes.description: Your dark magic-imbued eyes reveal other @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} creatures, helping you ambush them. You constantly gain the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.jwK43yKsHTkJQvQ9]{See the Unseen} spell.

Harden Soil.name: Harden Soil
Harden Soil.description: You have greater control over hardening earth magic, allowing you to become slightly more resistant to damage. When an earth power grants you resistance or hardness based on your level, you gain resistance or hardness as if your level was 1 higher than normal.

Harvest Celebration.name: Harvest Celebration
Harvest Celebration.description: Whenever you harvest, you celebrate as the wood energy courses through you. After using a power and choosing to harvest, if you harvested at least one plant, you gain a +1 status bonus to Perception checks, skill checks, and saving throws for 1 round. If you're legendary in power DCs, you instead gain a +2 status bonus to Perception checks, skill checks, and saving throws.

Have Pot, Will Travel.name: Have Pot, Will Travel
Have Pot, Will Travel.description: Part of your form is a living pot, which you can use for protection. As a single action, you can Retreat Into your Pot. If you do, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}. These effects last until the end of your next turn, though you can end the effect early with a single action.

Hidden Shadow.name: Hidden Shadow
Hidden Shadow.description: When you're shrouded in darkness, you can Hide and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} more easily, crawling into every little nook and cranny. Your circumstance bonus to Stealth checks to Hide and Sneak from the @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN]{Shrouded} condition increases to +2 when you're shrouded 1, +3 when you're shrouded 2, and +4 when you're shrouded 3.

Hivemind Antennae.name: Hivemind Antennae
Hivemind Antennae.description: Thanks to your connection to your allies, your antennae pick up your foes' movements. Unless all your allies are also flanked, you aren't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to flanking creatures of your level or lower. However, they can still help their allies flank. You also aren't off-guard to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} or undetected creatures of your level or lower unless they're hidden or undetected to all your allies.

Ice Element.name: Ice Element
Ice Element.description:
The element of ice embodies the arctic chill of winter, ice, and snow. Thus, it focuses on powers that freeze and hamper enemies. While the frozen condition can't take away a foe's actions on its own, combined with movement and positioning, ice powers can put the foe in a position where it's forced to either spend an action removing the ice or moving twice, thanks to a reduced move speed. Ice users use these no-win situations to reduce their enemies' output, and they can learn other tricks to punish foes who choose to stay immobile, exploiting their high frozen value.

Ice Accumulation: While normally the frozen condition isn't cumulative, ice eldamon and ice elemental avatars can accumulate the frozen condition from their own powers to a maximum of 5 plus 1 for every 4 levels they have (maximum 10 at 20th level). This means that if a single elemental avatar causes a foe to gain the frozen 2 condition and then the frozen 3 condition, the foe becomes frozen 5. If two eldamon or elemental avatars both cause frozen conditions on the same creature, the values aren't cumulative.

Associated Damage Type: Cold

Associated Traits: Cold

Ice Key Terms

You'll see the following term in almost every ice elemental power.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W]{Frozen}: The frozen condition always has a value. A frozen creature's body is slowly freezing over, causing it to take a status penalty to its Speeds equal to –5-feet × the frozen value, for instance –20-feet for frozen 4. A frozen creature or an adjacent ally can spend an Interact action to remove the ice, reducing the frozen condition by 4. A creature with the fire trait instead reduces its (or its ally's) frozen condition by 5. A creature using an effect with the fire trait, or an effect that would deal fire damage, on a frozen creature can choose to reduce the frozen creature's frozen value by 4, whether the creature takes any fire damage or not. While the frozen condition is normally not cumulative (like other conditions), ice eldamon and elemental avatars have a special ability allowing them to accumulate the frozen condition from their own powers.

Interacting Without Hands

There is some ambiguity in the rules as to whether or not a creature without hands can use the Interact action; on the other hand, if they couldn't, it would be impossible for those creatures to remove the effect of bow critical specialization. In any case, for the purpose of the frozen condition, any creature can take the Interact action needed to remove frozen.

Other Abilities

If your element is ice, you gain the following abilities and effects from the Elemental Surge action, the Elemental Shield action, and the elemental avatar feats that vary by element.

Elemental Locomotion You freeze the water in the air beneath your feet, allowing you to momentarily walk on the air, before it thaws. Walking on this ice path is normally difficult terrain. When you Stride starting from a solid surface, you can move over thin air, ascending or descending at a maximum of a 45-degree angle, though after your Stride action is complete, if you aren't on a surface that can support your weight, you can take a single action that doesn't have the move trait or use an ice power and then you fall.

Elemental Manipulation When you use Elemental Manipulation, you can control cold and ice in minor ways, allowing you to chill an object or even freeze over or defrost a very small object, potentially providing momentary relief against environmental heat, slightly contracting chilled metal, making certain drinks tastier, and so on. At your GM's discretion, you can make other similar small adjustments.

Elemental Resistance Your body becomes accustomed to glacial chill. You are protected from severe environmental cold and gain resistance equal to half your level against cold damage. If you have the Enhanced Resistance feat, you also become protected against extreme environmental cold.

Elemental Sculptor When you use the Elemental Sculptor feat, you can sculpt and control ice and snow to a greater extent than Elemental Manipulation. This allows you to create rough shapes and features out of ice and snow in the area, roughly one 10-foot by 10-foot square at a time out to 20 feet, potentially allowing for a larger sculpture over time. At the GM's discretion, you can make other similar adjustments to ice, snow, and areas of magical cold.

Elemental Senses You can see through falling ice and snow as easily as through a clear sky. You can see through snow storms, ice storms, and the like. They don't impair your vision, and creatures who would be concealed only due to such precipitation aren't concealed to you. Additionally, you can see clearly through partially transparent sheets of ice that would otherwise conceal whatever was on the other side, but you can't see through solid opaque walls of ice or snow.

Elemental Shield If a foe misses their melee attack only because of the Elemental Shield's circumstance bonus to AC, the shield freezes the foe, and they become frozen 2.

Elemental Surge The chosen creature becomes frozen 2 unless they succeed at a Reflex save against your power DC, or frozen 1 on a success. They aren't frozen on a critical success.

Enhanced Locomotion When you freeze the air beneath you to support your weight, a stable platform of ice remains frozen beneath your feet until you step away. This allows you to walk on the air and remain in mid-air as long as you wish.

Icewalker.name: Icewalker
Icewalker.description: You ignore difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain from ice and snow and don't risk falling when crossing ice. You reduce the penalty to your Speeds from the frozen condition by 10 feet.

Iguana’s Verve.name: Iguana’s Verve
Iguana’s Verve.description: You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your saving throws against paralysis and sleep. If you roll a success against either condition, you get a critical success instead, and if you would be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} or put to sleep for at least 2 rounds, reduce that duration by 1 round.

Innate Defenses.name: Innate Defenses
Innate Defenses.description: Eldamon have innate defenses from their elements that protect them from harm, akin to armor for mortals. This grants them a +2 item bonus to AC and a +3 Maximum Dexterity. Additionally, an eldamon with a mortal friend (whether or not they're an eldamon trainer) can share their friend's armor potency rune and resilient rune, granting them an increased item bonus to AC and an item bonus to saving throws

Inner Light.name: Inner Light
Inner Light.description: The light within you spills out to sear your foes when you make a mandibles attack or when another creature cuts or pierces into you. Your mandibles Strikes deal 1d4 additional fire damage (reflected in the statistics above); this additional damage has the light trait. Additionally, when an adjacent creature deals slashing or piercing damage to you or a creature deals slashing or piercing damage to you with a melee unarmed attack, they take @Damage[1d4[fire]] damage; this fire damage has the light trait.

Inner Senses.name: Inner Senses
Inner Senses.description: By spending so much time looking within yourself, you've learned how to notice things around you as well. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to master.

Inner Truth.name: Inner Truth
Inner Truth.description: Instead of becoming Large, your evolved form peels away all pretensions and reveals your inner corner, transforming you into a Tiny fairy with mirror wings and a fly Speed of 40 feet.

Interposing Guardian.name: Interposing Guardian
Interposing Guardian.description: You get in the way of attacks against those you wish to protect. You provide standard cover instead of lesser cover against attacks through your space when you wish to do so.

Invisible Hand.name: Invisible Hand
Invisible Hand.description: When you're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf] due to your darkness powers, your darkness powers are more powerful. While you are hidden or undetected to a creature either due to the @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN] condition from your darkness powers or due to an area of dim light or darkness from your darkness powers, you gain a +2 status bonus to cold damage with darkness powers against that creature; this increases to +4 if you're an expert in power DCs, +5 if you're a master in power DCs, and +6 if you're legendary in power DCs. This bonus doesn't apply if you're hidden or undetected for another reason (such as an invisibility spell).

Jolt Spines.name: Jolt Spines
Jolt Spines.description: When a foe fumbles an attack, they strike a needle of electricity arcing across your body, shocking them. Whenever a foe critically fails an attack roll against you with a melee unarmed attack, or an adjacent foe critically fails any melee attack roll against you, they take @Damage[2[electricity]] damage. This damage increase to 4 if you're an expert in power DCs, 6 if you're a master in power DCs, and 8 if you're legendary in power DCs. They then become @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.1fZbuJEbVmE3J4XL]{Shocked} for 1 round.

Kite Tail.name: Kite Tail
Kite Tail.description: Your rainbow-colored kite tail can fascinate foes, forcing them to focus their attention on you. You can use your kite tail to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EEDElIyin4z60PXx]{Perform}, rolling a Performance check against the Will DC of a single creature within 30 feet. On a success, that creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} with you for 1 round, or for 2 rounds on a critical success.

Legendary Elemental Potency.name: Legendary Elemental Potency
Legendary Elemental Potency.description: Your true synthesis with the eldamon you embody brings you overflowing power beyond the eldamon's own potential. Your proficiency rank for elemental power DCs of your element increases to legendary.

Legendary Skill (Eldamon).name: Legendary Skill (Eldamon)
Legendary Skill (Eldamon).description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.feats.Item.1bk6y3aVnl7ROhVM]{Legendary Skill}

You train your eldamon to become true legends in a skill of your choice. Choose a skill. All your eldamon with the chosen skill as an eldamon skill increase their proficiency rank in that skill from master to legendary. If you have the Focused Training feat and you choose a skill associated with one of the focused trainings from that feat, all your eldamon with that focused training gain an additional skill feat depending on the skill you chose:

  • Acrobatics: Your nimble eldamon gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.gBSPbQRXdagZTUwY]{Kip Up} skill feat.
  • Athletics: Your brawny eldamon gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.P04Hw8E6WAWARKHP]{Quick Climb} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.bFoh3267kNLk68cU]{Quick Swim} skill feat (choose for each brawny eldamon).
  • Intimidation: Your terrifying eldamon gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.dc8X2Mbtwq6kGp7F]{Terrified Retreat} skill feat.
  • Performance: Your enthralling eldamon gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.4UXyMtXLaOxuH6Js]{Distracting Performance} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.lFwfUvH2708rl6i3]{Virtuosic Performer} skill feats.
  • Stealh: Your sneaky eldamon gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.Imvu2RV2ggjJ2HZt]{Swift Sneak} skill feat.
  • Survival: Your self-sufficient eldamon gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.Yj4mpROEjdCjQzMd]{Planar Survival} skill feat.
  • Thievery: Your burglarious eldamon gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.IZbjUaZI5zHTd1Vp]{Legendary Thief} skill feat.

Note: Place this feature on your Eldamon actors

Life Element.name: Life Element
Life Element.description:
The element of life embodies birth, healing rebirth, and the vital essence that permeates all living creatures, giving them their instincts, intuition, and collective faith. Life users focus on preservation and rejuvenation, mainly via temporary Hit Points, keeping themselves and their allies healthy and refreshed no matter the threat.

Vital Resurgence: Your temporary Hit Points are full of resurgent life energy. If a creature has 0 Hit Points and gains temporary Hit Points from your life power, they regain 1 Hit Point. Once per hour, instead of granting temporary Hit Points with your life power, you can choose to heal a creature for an equal amount of Hit Points; the creature then becomes temporarily immune to this substitution for 1 hour.

Associated Damage Type: Vitality

Associated Traits: Vitality

Life Key Terms

You'll see the following term in several life elemental powers.

Recovery: A recovery effect is a healing effect that recovers from a particular damage source. Recover effects often happen simultaneously to a damage source, effectively reducing the damage. A recovery effect can never heal more damage than the amount of actual Hit Points (not temporary Hit Points) the creature loses from the linked damage source, even if several recovery effects happen at once. When the healing is simultaneous to the damage, it can potentially prevent the healed creature from being reduced to 0 Hit Points and becoming unconscious, though if the remaining damage is still enough to knock them unconscious, the healing doesn't wake them up. Recovery effects that happen at a different timing can wake a creature from being unconscious as normal, though they still can't heal a creature more than the amount of actual Hit Points they lost, even in combination with other recovery effects.

Other Abilities

If your element is life, you gain the following abilities and effects from the Elemental Surge action, the Elemental Shield action, and the elemental avatar feats that vary by element.

Elemental Locomotion You can transmit yourself through a creature's life force in order to move through its space. As a single action, which has the move trait, you move through an adjacent living creature's space, even if they're a foe, to any other space adjacent to that creature. This movement doesn't trigger reactions based on movement.

Elemental Manipulation When you use Elemental Manipulation, you can send waves of life into a dying creature within 30 feet in order to stabilize them. The creature loses the dying condition, though it remains unconscious at 0 Hit Points. Additionally, you can use Medicine without a healer's kit as long as you have a hand free, receiving a +1 item bonus to your Medicine check when you do so at 3rd level, a +2 item bonus at 9th level, and a +3 item bonus at 17th level. If you have Siphoning Element class feature, you gain the Battle Medicine skill feat and can use your life powers to Treat Wounds and provide Battle Medicine with your powers and without a healer's kit; when you use Treat Wounds and Battle Medicine in this way, on a success the target recovers additional Hit Points equal to your level, and the target becomes temporarily immune to Battle Medicine for only 1 hour, not 1 day. At your GM's discretion, you can make other similar small adjustments to life force.

Elemental Resistance Your body becomes bolstered by life energy, protecting you from dying. If you fail a recovery check while dying, your dying condition does not increase; if you critically fail, your dying condition increases by only 1. If you have the Enhanced Resistance feat, you automatically critically succeed at all recovery checks.

Elemental Sculptor When you use the Elemental Sculptor feat, you can sculpt and control life force more easily than with Elemental Manipulation. You can use Elemental Sculptor to use any Medicine skill action that takes two actions or fewer, or Treat Wounds, at a range of 60 feet.

Elemental Senses You can sense the life force of living creatures nearby, and its counterforce within undead. You gain lifesense as an imprecise sense out to 30 feet.

Elemental Shield When the shield expires, recover Hit Points equal to half your level, or the amount of damage you took while the shield was active, whichever is less. This is a recovery effect.

Elemental Surge The chosen creature gains temporary Hit Points equal to your level for 1 round.

Enhanced Locomotion Your connection to your allies allows you to tap into their life force from a distance to bring yourself to their side. As a single action, which has the move trait, you can briefly transition into life energy and then reappear in a space adjacent to an ally within 60 feet. You still need line of effect to your ally and you either must be able to detect them with a precise sense or with imprecise lifesense, but you don't need to cross the intervening squares, allowing you to avoid obstacles and hazardous terrain, and this movement doesn't trigger reactions based on movement.

Lifeguard Hair.name: Lifeguard Hair
Lifeguard Hair.description: Your tufts of red hair repel destruction when you are close to death. When you have fewer than half your maximum Hit Points, you gain resistance 1 to all damage types. If you are a master in power DCs, this increases to resistance 2 to all damage types.

Light Element.name: Light Element
Light Element.description:
The element of light reveals the truth and that which was hidden or unseen. But there is no one objective truth, and so light, when bent or shaped to the user's will, is also capable of misleading by revealing a distorted truth.

Light eldamon and elemental avatars use the light to reveal and emphasize the truth that they choose to show others.

Associated Damage Type: Fire

Associated Traits: Light

Light Key Terms

You'll see the following term in many light elemental powers.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.5tWqbv3Iu1FlrOx6]{Limned}: Light power and effects might give a creature the limned condition. A limned creature is surrounded by light, causing it to glow like a torch, outlining it and making its position obvious. A limned creature can't normally become concealed, due to the glowing light, though if the creature would otherwise be invisible, they become concealed instead. An invisible creature concealed while limned can't use the concealed condition to Hide or Sneak, as the lights give its exact location away. The limned condition doesn't prevent a creature with cover from Hiding or Sneaking. If a creature has the ability to Hide or Sneak without cover or concealment (such as by using camouflage), the shining light from the limned condition makes that much more difficult as long as the light is visible, giving a –4 circumstance penalty to the creature's Stealth check, as well as to its Stealth DCs against the Seek action. A shrouded creature that would become limned instead loses its shrouded condition, and vice versa.

Other Abilities

If your element is light, you gain the following abilities and effects from the Elemental Surge action, the Elemental Shield action, and the elemental avatar feats that vary by element.

Elemental Locomotion When you're in motion, you shine with light, dazzling those who try to stop you. While you're moving, foes who use a reaction or free action against you are momentarily dazzled while resolving their reaction or free action.

Elemental Manipulation When you use Elemental Manipulation, you can control light, calling forth a light and attaching it to a creature or object, or letting it float in mid-air, with the effects of a light cantrip. At your GM's discretion, you can make other small adjustments to light.

Elemental Resistance You become protected against light. You gain resistance equal to half your level against damage from light effects and a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against such effects, as well as any effect that would make you dazzled or blinded. If you have Enhanced Resistances, the circumstance bonus increases to +2.

Elemental Sculptor When you use the Elemental Sculptor feat, you can move and control light to a greater extent than Elemental Manipulation. This allows you to twist and shape light into various forms, adjusting their position or appearance, in up to a 10-foot by 10-foot area within 20 feet. At the GM's discretion, you can make other similar adjustments to light's shape or position.

Elemental Senses The light reveals hidden secrets around you. When you come within 10 feet of a hidden object, creature, or secret door, the GM rolls an automatic secret Perception check for you to find it, even if you aren't Searching. This doesn't help you find or identify traps, haunts, and other hazards, only objects, creatures, and secret doors.

Elemental Shield If a foe misses their melee attack only because of the Elemental Shield's circumstance bonus to AC, the shield dazzles the foe with light, and they become dazzled until the end of your next turn.

Elemental Surge The chosen creature becomes limned until the end of your next turn.

Enhanced Locomotion You can move in a straight line with the speed of light, like a ray of light. If you Stride (or use another form of movement if you have it) in a straight line, you can choose to do so at the speed of light. If you do, creatures and hazards can't use reactions or free actions against you unless they can react faster than the speed of light, and you can run up walls or other vertical surfaces, as long as you end your movement on a surface that can support you.

Lightning Rod Tail.name: Lightning Rod Tail
Lightning Rod Tail.description: When an electricity effect targets a creature within 30 feet of you or includes a line within 30 feet of you, if it could have targeted you or aimed the line to hit you, you can choose to attempt a counteract check using your power DC – 10 as your counteract modifier and half your level (rounded up) as your counteract level. If you succeed, instead of ending the effect, you force it to target you, or to aim to include you. If there are several ways to do so, the originator makes all other decisions as long as they target or include you.

Locus Arms.name: Locus Arms
Locus Arms.description: Your arms are myriad, powered by force energy, and geometrically stable as you move across the ground. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your Fortitude or Reflex DC against attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} you. This bonus also applies to saving throws against spells or effects that attempt to move you or knock you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. When an effect would force you to move while you are near a wall, ceiling, or other edge with easy handholds, you can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} with your arms to reduce the forced movement by 20 feet on a success or 30 feet on a critical success, instead of reducing falling distance.

Locus of Force.name: Locus of Force
Locus of Force.description: Your understanding of geometry allows you to apply your force across a wider locus of points. The range of your force powers that have a range increases by 20 feet. This only affects the range at which you can affect targets; it doesn't increase the distance you can reposition them. The area of your burst, cone, and emanation force powers increases by 5 feet in length or radius. If you're an expert in power DCs, the area increases by 10 feet in length or radius instead.

Lost and Altered Actions.name: Lost and Altered Actions
Lost and Altered Actions.description:
Normally you can't act while you've shifted phases with your eldamon, but if you have a way to do so, you share your actions with your eldamon. If your eldamon becomes slowed, stunned, quickened, or otherwise affected by something that changes the actions you gain at the start of each turn, it affects your shared actions, but if you have such a condition, it ordinarily doesn't affect your shared actions (though if you're prevented from acting entirely, you can't use any special actions that work while you're phased out). The GM resolves any situation that's unclear.

You, as the player, control both your eldamon trainer and your eldamon, and the two are generally considered to cooperate unless you decide for them not to. Once you've shared your phase, however, the eldamon is in control until it relinquishes that phase. If there's ever a conflict of who should act, your eldamon wins out over you. This means that if the eldamon comes under an effect that would take their actions out of your control, such as the confused or controlled condition, your eldamon uses all the shared actions, preventing you from acting, and they can prevent you from forcibly phasing them out via Sudden Switch, Emergency Phase, and similar effects. Your eldamon can also prevent you from acting for your own good if you're confused or controlled while phased out, but this is much less likely to occur.

Magical Disruption.name: Magical Disruption
Magical Disruption.description: Your powers that stupefy foes disrupt spellcasting more than normal. The flat check DC to Cast a Spell while stupefied by your mind powers increases from 5 plus the stupefied condition's value to 7 plus the stupefied condition's value.

Mane of Shadow.name: Mane of Shadow
Mane of Shadow.description: Your mane of shadow swirls around you protectively in dim light. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to AC when in dim light, which increases to a +3 circumstance bonus if you're attacked while you're using a move action to move in dim light.

Mantle of Darkness.name: Mantle of Darkness
Mantle of Darkness.description: Your ruff transformed into a mantle of swirling shadows that settle around you when you aren't moving, such as when holding still in a narrow place. You can Hide (though not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}) without cover or concealment, and if you don't act for 1 round (or about 6 seconds out of a combat encounter), you become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} by the mantle of darkness until you move or make a significant motion.

Manual Dexterity.name: Manual Dexterity
Manual Dexterity.description: As a monkey, you have more manual dexterity than other eldamon. You can perform Interact actions and hold basic objects. This doesn't allow you to wield weapons, shields, or most held magical or alchemical items, though you can pick up and feed yourself potions, elixirs, and similar simple potables.

Massive Growth.name: Massive Growth
Massive Growth.description: You grow larger than most evolved forms, and the reach of your massive body is even greater than normal. You are Huge, instead of Large, and your body has a 20 foot reach; the reach has been reflected in the above statistics.

Master Elemental Potency.name: Master Elemental Potency
Master Elemental Potency.description: Your bond with the eldamon within you becomes so extensive that your power swells nearly to bursting. Your proficiency rank for elemental power DCs of your element increases to master.

Melded Phase.name: Melded Phase
Melded Phase.description: When you (but not your eldamon) Phase Eldamon, instead of becoming rooted in place, you can choose to meld your phased out form with your eldamon. This takes a visual form of your choice: you can disappear inside the eldamon's battle form, appear as if mounted on the eldamon, or take a different form. However you appear, you move alongside your phased in eldamon, and when you phase back in, you do so in the same position where your eldamon phased out.

Mental Assistance.name: Mental Assistance
Mental Assistance.description:
Your powers hone in on the enemies' weak points to help your allies strike your foes. After you use an active mental power against one or more foes, choose one foe that you successfully hit with a power attack roll or that failed their saving throw against your power. Your next ally to make an attack roll against that foe before your next turn gains a +1 circumstance bonus to their attack roll.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.kIks4KlAUBGzzbdO]{Effect: Mental Assistance}

Mental Wreath.name: Mental Wreath
Mental Wreath.description: Your head and upper body are wreathed with powerful mental energy. A creature that attempts a melee unarmed Strike or a non-reach melee Strike against you (whether or not it hits you) takes @Damage[4[mental]] damage, with a @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save against your power DC. At 19th level, this increases to @Damage[5[mental]] damage.

Mind Element.name: Mind Element
Mind Element.description:
The element of mind encompasses the elemental nature of mental essence, the foundation of the Astral Plane, the Dreamlands, and other mental realms. Thus, it focuses on powers that assault, bewilder, or overwhelm the minds of others.

Lethal Trauma: Your mind powers are capable of causing enough psychic trauma to kill. When you use a mind power that deals mental damage, you can choose whether or not to give the power the nonlethal trait. If you don't, the power is potentially lethal.

Associated Damage Type: Mental

Associated Traits: Mental

Other Abilities

If your element is mind, you gain the following abilities and effects from the Elemental Surge action, the Elemental Shield action, and the elemental avatar feats that vary by element.

Elemental Locomotion You can propel your body purely with your mind, though the movement is coarse. As long as you move in a straight line, the Stride action is a purely mental action for you, which means you can take it while paralyzed.

Elemental Manipulation When you use Elemental Manipulation, you can slightly adjust the mental state of a creature within 20 feet. Normally this is a minor mood alteration, but it could potentially make it slightly easier or harder to succeed at a skill check in a social situation.

Elemental Resistance Your mind is resilient to mental effects, especially those that control your actions or emotions. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus on saving throws against mental effects that cause the controlled condition or have the emotion trait, and you gain resistance equal to half your level against mental damage. If you have the Enhanced Resistance feat, your circumstance bonus on saving throws increases to +2.

Elemental Sculptor When you use the Elemental Sculptor feat, you can more significantly affect the mental state of a creature. This allows you to communicate information into their mind rapidly, with an effect similar to mindlink or to help a creature calm down, decreasing their frightened value by 1. At the GM's discretion, you might be able to perform other similar adjustments to a creature's mental state.

Elemental Senses You can detect nearby thoughts from other creatures. You gain thoughtsense as an imprecise sense out to 30 feet.

Elemental Shield The shield also grants a +1 circumstance bonus to Will saves.

Elemental Surge The chosen creature is stupefied 1 until the end of your next turn unless they succeed at a Will save against your power DC.

Enhanced Locomotion Your purely mental motion is especially refined. You can Stride and Step normally using only your mind, and if you have other Speeds, you can use the associated move actions with your mind as well, even if you would normally need to flap your wings to Fly or move your fins to Swim.

Mirrored Rebound.name: Mirrored Rebound
Mirrored Rebound.description: When a foe's magic misses you completely, you use your stored light energy to bounce the magic back at them. While your mirror has light energy stored up, when a foe critically fails an attack roll with a spell or power against you, they must reroll the attack roll with their same modifier against themself. If they hit, they deal the effects of their spell or power to themself. This uses the stored light energy, which returns over the course of the next 10 minutes.

Moment of Contemplation.name: Moment of Contemplation
Moment of Contemplation.description:
When you pause for a moment to contemplate during a battle, your mental defenses increase. During a combat encounter, when you use a refresh power or a surge on your turn and don't use an active power, you gain a +2 status bonus to Will saves until your next turn. If you use Mind Palace, you gain a +4 status bonus instead.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.ObbcWR5zFNTqWgtD]{Effect: Moment of Contemplation}

Moss Cover.name: Moss Cover
Moss Cover.description: When you're surrounded by plants, the moss on your body provides you protection. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your AC and Reflex saves whenever you are in difficult terrain caused by plants, including plants you sowed.

One Mind.name: One Mind
One Mind.description: The eldamon within bolsters your mind. Your proficiency rank for Will saves increases to master. When you roll a success at a Will save, you get a critical success instead.

Paper Folding.name: Paper Folding
Paper Folding.description: You can fold yourself in order to easily fit through narrow areas. You can fit through narrow spaces as if you were two sizes smaller (a Tiny creature if you're Medium or smaller, a Small creature if you're Large, a Medium creature if you're Huge, and a Large creature if you're Gargantuan).

Parchment Furling.name: Parchment Furling
Parchment Furling.description: You can furl and unfurl your body like parchment, allowing you to grab onto multiple objects or creatures with ease and extending your reach. By unfurling itself and extending, your foot's reach increases to 20 feet (already reflected in its statistics). Additionally, your six wings and your main body can each hold a Medium or smaller creature you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple}, though if you don't have at least two wings free, you can't Fly. As long as you have at least one wing or your body free, you can use them to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge}. This doesn't allow you to Grapple more than a single creature at once, only to hold onto more creatures than normal.

Phosphorescent Glow.name: Phosphorescent Glow
Phosphorescent Glow.description: After your initial flash of light, you leave a momentary phosphorescent glow. When the @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.5tWqbv3Iu1FlrOx6]{Limned} condition from your light power or surge ends, a pale blue glow limns the target for 1 additional round. This limned condition doesn't come from the original power, so it doesn't apply any additional effects from that power.

Plantwalker.name: Plantwalker
Plantwalker.description: You ignore any difficult or greater difficult terrain caused by plants and fungi, such as bushes, vines, and undergrowth. Even plants and fungi manipulated by magic don't impede your progress. Additionally, you can Hide and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} in areas of difficult terrain caused by plants, including plants you sowed, even if they don't provide concealment or cover.

Portal Antlers.name: Portal Antlers
Portal Antlers.description: You can use the elemental ice portal between your antlers to aim your ice powers. Choose any space within your antlers' 10- foot reach as the origin point for any of your ice powers. This not only allows you to effectively increase their range by 10 feet in most cases, but also allows you to position area effects more advantageously.

Power of Three.name: Power of Three
Power of Three.description: When you harvest wood elemental energy, you bring down your wrath on your foes threefold. When you harvest with a damaging power, you gain a +2 status bonus to the power's damage against creatures with a harvested plant in their square. This increases to +4 if you're an expert in power DC, +5 if you're a master in power DC, and +6 if you're legendary in power DC.

Prism Power.name: Prism Power
Prism Power.description: When your foe is limned in light, your light powers deal additional damage. While a creature has the @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.5tWqbv3Iu1FlrOx6]{Limned} condition, you gain a +1 status bonus to fire damage with light powers against that creature; this increases to +3 if you're an expert in power DCs, +4 if you're a master in power DCs, and +5 if you're legendary in power DCs.

Prismatic Cloak.name: Prismatic Cloak
Prismatic Cloak.description: The rainbow-colored cloak trailing behind you protects you from harm, especially from those @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} by your light. You gain resistance 5 to physical damage dealt by creatures dazzled by your light powers. This resistance increases to 6 at level 18.

Prism’s Perception.name: Prism’s Perception
Prism’s Perception.description: The prism on your head helps refine the sights around you and refract them into your view, making it easy for you to spot things. You're an expert in Perception, and at 9th level, you become a master in Perception.

Protective Armor.name: Protective Armor
Protective Armor.description: You wear electrified heavy armor. Your item bonus to AC from armor increases to +6, your maximum Dexterity modifier decreases to +0, and your Speed decreases to 20 feet.

Protective Wings.name: Protective Wings
Protective Wings.description: Your huge wings are especially solid compared to other air eldamon. As a single action, you can interpose your wings. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to AC and Reflex saves until the beginning of your next turn, and you increase the circumstance bonus to AC from wind's mobility to +4 for the same duration.

Protrusive Cover.name: Protrusive Cover
Protrusive Cover.description: Your earth power seeps out of you, allowing you to grant your allies additional cover. Whenever you give your allies lesser cover against an attack made through your space, you grant them a +2 circumstance bonus to AC instead of the usual +1 circumstance bonus to AC.

Puppet Tail.name: Puppet Tail
Puppet Tail.description:
Your tail can lure foes off guard and distract them. As a single action, you can attempt a @Check[type:performance|defense:perception] check against a creature's Perception DC, causing them to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the end of your next turn on a success.

If you attempt a tail Strike, after resolving the Strike, the target becomes off-guard until the end of your turn unless the Strike was a critical failure. While a foe is off-guard due to your tail, your movements don't trigger reactions from that foe based on movement (such as Reactive Strikes and similar reactions).

Quadruple Tails.name: Quadruple Tails
Quadruple Tails.description: Your tails split into four spiralling tails, increasing their reach to 20 feet. Additionally, your four tails help you steady your increasingly powerful amethyst sled, allowing you ignore all difficult terrain on the ground, not just difficult terrain from rubble, sand, or snow.

Questing Beast.name: Questing Beast
Questing Beast.description:
You can be a guiding star for others to reach their quest or a will-o'-wisp leading them astray. As a single action, which has the concentrate and mental trait, you can attempt a Deception check against the lower of the Perception DC or Will DC of a creature within 30 feet. On a success, you choose whether to give them a +1 circumstance bonus on their next Perception check or Will save within 1 round or to make them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round. On a critical success, you can grant a +2 circumstance bonus or make the creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}.

@Check[type:deception|defense:perception]{Deception (Perception DC)}

@Check[type:deception|defense:will]{Deception (Will DC)}

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.QY2ivwj9QhtfSXMR]{Effect: Questing Beast (Beneficial Effects)}

Raging Cycle.name: Raging Cycle
Raging Cycle.description:
Your power and defenses fluctuate with the tides. After using a high tide power, you take a –1 penalty to your AC for 1 round. After using a low tide power, you gain a +1 status bonus to AC for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.P8x7JPyttwN2tgsz]{Effect: Raging Cycle}

When using a high tide water power, you gain a +2 status bonus to damage rolls. This increases to +3 if you're an expert in power DCs, +4 if you're a master in power DCs, and +5 if you're legendary in power DCs.

Rainbow Banner.name: Rainbow Banner
Rainbow Banner.description: The rainbow banner that flies from your tail can inspire your allies. Allies within 30 feet who can see the banner gain a +1 status bonus to saving throws against fear, and you can wave the banner as a single action in order to prepare to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Aid} an ally's attack roll using Art Lore.

Rainbow Light.name: Rainbow Light
Rainbow Light.description:
When you deal damage with your light powers, instead of dealing fire damage, roll [[/r 1d8]]. On a:

1 the light is red and your power deals fire damage
2 the light is orange and your power deals acid damage
3 the light is yellow and your power deals electricity damage
4 the light is green and your power deals poison damage
5 the light is blue and your power deals sonic damage
6 the light is indigo and your power deals mental damage
7 the light is violet and your power deals force damage
8 you choose one of the 7 colors and damage types.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.wHJXoM6YjRi0sfFj]

If your power deals damage over time, you still only roll once to determine the color of the light and deal that damage type for the duration of the power.

Rampaging.name: Rampaging
Rampaging.description: Your electric charges rampage through your foes, allowing them to occasionally cling even after they suffer electricity damage. When a foe @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.1fZbuJEbVmE3J4XL]{Shocked} from your elemental powers takes electricity damage from your elemental powers, the foe must attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:5]. On a success, they lose the shocked condition as normal, whereas on a failure, they retain the charge and remain shocked. However, this doesn't extend the duration of their shocked condition.

Rebirth.name: Rebirth
Rebirth.description: When you would be reduced to 0 Hit Points, you are reborn and rise again. Instead of being reduced to 0 Hit Points, you remain at 1 Hit Point and gain temporary Hit Points equal to your level. Once you've benefited from rebirth, you can't benefit from it again for [[/r 1d4 #hours]]{1d4 hours}.

Red String of Fate.name: Red String of Fate
Red String of Fate.description:
You can use the unraveled strings of your scarf to latch onto foes at quite a distance, tying their fate to you. You can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} foes at a distance of up to 20 feet. Foes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by your scarf take a –1 circumstance penalty to Fortitude saves against your death powers.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.Rp6cajsVgmi0S5AY]{Effect: Red String of Fate}

Reflex Expertise.name: Reflex Expertise
Reflex Expertise.description: Your reflexes are lightning fast. Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to expert.

Regal Nemes.name: Regal Nemes
Regal Nemes.description: Your shiny headdress proves you once and for all as truly regal and magnificent, while protecting you from effects that would seek to steal your sovereignty. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against emotion effects and effects that apply the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9qGBRpbX9NEwtAAr]{Controlled} condition. If you roll a success on a saving throw against such an effect, you get a critical success instead.

Rending Claws.name: Rending Claws
Rending Claws.description: Your claws and powers more easily dig through solid objects. Your claw Strikes and earth powers ignore an amount of Hardness equal to half your level (minimum 1); as normal, this has no effect on resistance.

Repel Light.name: Repel Light
Repel Light.description: You use the power of mirrors to repel foes @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.5tWqbv3Iu1FlrOx6]{Limned} in your light. You gain a +1 status bonus to AC against foes limned by your light powers or surges.

Resistant Shell.name: Resistant Shell
Resistant Shell.description: You have an outer shell of energy that's electrically resistant, allowing you to safely store charge. When you are @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.Bi2aHykg6CZrQCnR]{Charged} from your own elemental powers, you don't become @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.1fZbuJEbVmE3J4XL]{Shocked}, and you don't reduce your charged condition from effects that would remove the shocked condition.

Resurgent Awakening.name: Resurgent Awakening
Resurgent Awakening.description: You and those you heal awake from @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconsciousness} with the energy you need to re-enter the fight, like a bear coming out of hibernation. Whenever you are healed from 0 Hit Points and wake up from the unconscious or dying condition, on your next turn, you are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} but can only use the action to Stand or to Interact to pick up something you dropped when you fell unconscious. Whenever you heal a creature from 0 Hit Points with a life power and they wake up from the unconscious or dying condition, they gain the same benefit.

Resurgent Life.name: Resurgent Life
Resurgent Life.description: You can spread life all around, as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. This causes living creatures such as plants to grow and move toward you, providing you standard cover until the beginning of your next turn.

Retreat Into Shell.name: Retreat Into Shell
Retreat Into Shell.description:
As a single action, you can Retreat Into your Shell. If you do, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}. These effects last until the end of your next turn, though you can end the effect early with a single action.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.gwtf7QTAuTbNSQ3F]{Effect: Retreat Into Shell}

Retreat Into Strawberry.name: Retreat Into Strawberry
Retreat Into Strawberry.description: As a single action, you can Retreat Into your Shell. If you do, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}. These effects last until the end of your next turn, though you can end the effect early with a single action.

Retributive Eruption.name: Retributive Eruption
Retributive Eruption.description: When a creature critically hits you with a melee Strike, the volcano on your back erupts, dealing @Damage[(floor(@actor.level/2))[fire]] damage to that creature equal to half your level, with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save using your power DC.

Riding a Pale Horse.name: Riding a Pale Horse
Riding a Pale Horse.description: Your base land Speed is 40 feet instead of 25 feet. This benefit is already reflected in your statistics.

Sand Shroud.name: Sand Shroud
Sand Shroud.description: When you're hit, you shroud yourself with sand that conceals you from follow-up attacks. If a creature hits you with a Strike, the impact launches a shroud of sand, causing you to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} by the sand until the end of that creature's turn.

Scapegoat.name: Scapegoat
Scapegoat.description: Whenever an adjacent ally takes damage and you are conscious with more than 1 Hit Point, you lose 1 Hit Point (or the amount of damage, whichever is less) and reduce the damage they take by the same amount. If you are a master in power DCs and have more than 2 Hit Points, you lose 2 Hit Points instead of 1.

Scarab of Protection.name: Scarab of Protection
Scarab of Protection.description: The life energies within you protect you from the forces of poison, death, and disease. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against poison, death, and disease effects. If you roll a success on a saving throw against a death effect, you get a critical success instead.

Scarf Glide.name: Scarf Glide
Scarf Glide.description: Your scarf allows you to glide through the air. As a single action, which has the move trait, you move 5 feet toward the ground and up to 25 feet through the air. Like flying eldamon, you land on the ground at the end of your turn if you aren't combined with your eldamon trainer through Melded Phase, though you can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.qm7xptMSozAinnPS]{Arrest the Fall}.

Segmented Capacitor.name: Segmented Capacitor
Segmented Capacitor.description: You've segmented off your electric charge, granting you higher capacity. You can become @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.Bi2aHykg6CZrQCnR]{Charged} up to charged 4, instead of charged 3. Once per 10 minutes, when you are charged 2 and would gain a single charge from an electricity power, you become charged 4 instead of charged 3; this has no effect if you weren't already charged 2 before using the power.

Shadow Dance.name: Shadow Dance
Shadow Dance.description: You dance swiftly and gracefully on the edge of shadows. You gain a +10-foot status bonus to your Speeds when you start your movement in an area of dim light or darkness, and while in the shadows of dim light, you ignore difficult terrain.

Shadow Eruption.name: Shadow Eruption
Shadow Eruption.description: The top of your hand body erupts with cold lightless flames of darkness energy when you use darkness powers. Whenever you use a darkness power, for 1 round, a creature that hits you with a melee unarmed Strike or a non-reach melee Strike takes @Damage[(ceil(@actor.level/2))[cold]] damage equal to half your level (minimum 1), with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save against your power DC.

Shadow Flight.name: Shadow Flight
Shadow Flight.description: The bottom of your body trails away into shadows, allowing you to soar. You gain a fly Speed equal to your Speed, and your body of twisting shadow gives you a +1 circumstance bonus to Acrobatics checks made to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}.

Shell Fortification.name: Shell Fortification
Shell Fortification.description: Your shell fortifies you from dangerous blows. You gain resistance equal to half your level to precision damage, and when a creature critically hits you, you can attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:17]. On a success, the critical hit becomes a normal hit instead.

Shovelling Dig.name: Shovelling Dig
Shovelling Dig.description: You can use your shovel tail to quickly dig your way across the battlefield. You gain a 20 foot burrow Speed, allowing you to dig through soft earth and other surfaces of similar consistency.

Shrouded Grace.name: Shrouded Grace
Shrouded Grace.description: When you're shrouded in darkness, you can move faster, as the shadows push you where you want to go. While you have the @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN] condition, you gain a +10-foot circumstance bonus to your Speeds, and you can move your full Speed when you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}.

Shrouded Power.name: Shrouded Power
Shrouded Power.description: When you're shrouded in darkness, your darkness powers deal additional damage. While you have the shrouded condition, you gain a +1 status bonus to cold damage with darkness powers; this increases to +3 if you're an expert in power DCs, +4 if you're a master in power DCs, and +5 if you're legendary in power DCs.

Silken Puff.name: Silken Puff
Silken Puff.description: You surround yourself in a puff of airy silk, providing you something akin to cover against ranged attacks and damaging area effects. The puff grants you a +1 circumstance bonus to AC against ranged attacks and to Reflex saves against damaging effects.

Sinuous Backflow.name: Sinuous Backflow
Sinuous Backflow.description: When you use an area water power, if you're in the area, or your area water power originates from your square (such as a line or cone area power), you can choose to let your power move you any of the same distances your allies can choose to move. However, you move in the opposite direction as the other creatures. For example, this means you move back and away from a high tide line or cone, further distancing yourself from any foes who were pushed back, and toward a low tide line or cone, further approaching foes who were pulled toward you. If the area power is a burst or an emanation, and it's centered on you, you can move in whichever direction you choose regardless of the tide.

Siphoning Element.name: Siphoning Element
Siphoning Element.description: Because of the interaction between your mortal body and the eldamon within, you relate to your element in a multifaceted way, allowing you to use elemental powers in a way different than ordinary, to siphon or nullify elemental energy rather than manifest it. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.actions.Item.4w72ljp4eLBqeZB2]{Siphoning Element} action.

Sixfold Spiked Legs.name: Sixfold Spiked Legs
Sixfold Spiked Legs.description: You gain a third pair of legs that are covered with spikes. Your land Speed increases to 30 feet, and when you move through a foe's space (usually either because you are three sizes larger or you Tumbled Through their space), they take @Damage[1d8[piercing]] damage. A creature only takes this piercing damage once per round, no matter how many times you move through this space. Your tongue's reach increases to 20 feet.

Slide.name: Slide
Slide.description: When you slide on your belly, you can move faster in a straight line. Whenever you Stride, you can choose to slide on your belly. If you do, you must move in a straight line, but you gain a +15-foot circumstance bonus to your Speed.

Slippery Eel.name: Slippery Eel
Slippery Eel.description: It's especially difficult for your foes to hold onto you or find you when you're hiding from them. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} and to Stealth checks to Hide. If you roll a success on a check to Escape, you get a critical success instead.

Smoke Tail.name: Smoke Tail
Smoke Tail.description: When you remain in the same position without moving for at least 2 consecutive rounds, smoke from your tail causes you to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} until you move again. As normal for concealment that gives away your position, you can't use it to Hide.

Snow Fur.name: Snow Fur
Snow Fur.description: Your fluffy snowlike fur grants you protection against creatures' attacks the more their chill accumulates. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to AC against a creature's attacks when they are frozen 3 or more from your ice powers, which increases to +2 when they are frozen 6 or more, +3 when they are frozen 9 or more, and +4 when they are frozen 12 or more.

So Many Legs.name: So Many Legs
So Many Legs.description: Due to your extreme number of legs, it's difficult to knock you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. You gain a +4 circumstance bonus to Fortitude and Reflex saves and DCs against effects that would knock you prone.

Spectral Flame.name: Spectral Flame
Spectral Flame.description: You can move the spectral flame that dances between your antlers like a will-o'-wisp. The spectral flame provides dim illumination within 60 feet. As a free action, once per turn, you can turn the flame off or on, or move the flame up to 60 feet. As long as the flame is in your space, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Deception checks to use your questing beast ability.

Spiked Carapace.name: Spiked Carapace
Spiked Carapace.description: Your carapace is covered in spikes. A creature that hits you with a melee unarmed Strike or a non-reach melee Strike takes @Damage[(ceil(@actor.level/2))[piercing]] damage equal to half your level (minimum 1), with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save against your power DC.

Spreading Flame.name: Spreading Flame
Spreading Flame.description: Your fire powers spread mischievously beyond their normal area. When you use a fire power that has an area of effect, choose one square adjacent to the normal area to include in the area.

Static Fur.name: Static Fur
Static Fur.description: Your fur gathers up electricity when you charge and rampage around. If you spend at least three of your actions on your turn to Stride and don't use a power on that turn, you become @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.Bi2aHykg6CZrQCnR]{Charged} at the end of the turn.

Stir the Pot.name: Stir the Pot
Stir the Pot.description: When you reposition a foe using your force powers, you can move them just a little bit more. Whenever your force power allows you to reposition a foe 10 feet or more, you can reposition them 5 more feet. If your force power allows you to reposition a foe 30 feet or more, you can reposition them 10 more feet instead.

Strength of the Earth.name: Strength of the Earth
Strength of the Earth.description: The earth itself provides you with overflowing energy that protects you from harm. During an encounter, if you start your turn on the ground, in direct contact with a rock or earthen surface, you gain 1 temporary Hit Point until the beginning of your next turn. This increases to 2 temporary Hit Points if you're an expert in power DC, 3 temporary Hit Points if you're a master in power DC, and 4 temporary Hit Points if you're legendary in power DC.

Surging Currents.name: Surging Currents
Surging Currents.description: When you move a foe at least 10 feet with your water powers, you can move them up to 5 additional feet, and when you move a foe at least 30 feet with your water powers, you can move them up to 10 additional feet.

Telekinetic Storm.name: Telekinetic Storm
Telekinetic Storm.description: Whether you're trying to disguise your force powers as a different kind of power or just enjoy moving objects around, you deliver force powers via objects even when others would use aether, pure threads of spun force. Any time your force power would deal force damage, you can choose to have it deal bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage instead (your choice) via the use of small objects. If the power would already throw an object and deal one of those damage types, you instead gain a +1 status bonus to the damage roll; this status bonus increases to +2 if you're an expert in power DCs, +3 if you're a master in power DCs, and +4 if you're legendary in power DCs.

Tentacle Tail.name: Tentacle Tail
Tentacle Tail.description: Your tail splits into eight tentacles, increasing its reach to 20 feet. Additionally, your land Speed and swim Speed increase to 40 feet. These adjustment are included in the statblock.

Tentacles of Water.name: Tentacles of Water
Tentacles of Water.description: You can transform the motive force of your water powers into tendrils that throw off your foes' stance instead. If your water power would move a foe at least 10 feet, you can choose not to move the foe and instead make them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the beginning of your next turn. If your water power would move them at least 20 feet and you choose not to move them, they become off-guard until the end of your next turn, and if it would move them at least 40 feet and you choose not to move them, they become off-guard for 2 rounds.

The Eld.name: The Eld
The Eld.description:
Divine Sanctification: none

Temples: ley line nexuses, monasteries, wilderness shrines

Worshippers: druids, elementalists

Sacred Animal: all

Sacred Colors: the twenty elemental colors, or "icosachrome"

Domains: air, earth, fire, nature, water

Cleric Spells: 1st: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.zDJS8E66UI0himqV], 5th: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.lpT6LotUaQPfinjj], 9th: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.jrBa9deU2ULFWvSl]

Favored Weapon: fist

Divine Attribute: Constitution or Wisdom

Divine Skill: Nature

Divine Font: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]

Key Edicts: find your own path, respect the elements and their manifestations, treat others as equal under the Eld

Key Anathema: force others to follow your beliefs, corrupt or defile the elements or their manifestations, beseech the Eld for favoritism

Thousand Breaths.name: Thousand Breaths
Thousand Breaths.description: The countless life essences you've absorbed from final breaths emerge from your body, harming foes who attack you. A creature that hits you with a melee unarmed Strike or a non-reach melee Strike takes @Damage[(max(@actor.level/2,1))[void]] damage equal to half your level (minimum 1), with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save against your power DC.

Trained Eldamon.name: Trained Eldamon
Trained Eldamon.description:
You have a deeper metaphysical link to eldamon than others, allowing you to connect with them on a deeper level than most. This allows you to train eldamon and even to swap your personal phase with them, phasing out of the material world so your eldamon can phase in. You begin at 1st level with three eldamon, which can be either common eldamon of your choice or other eldamon to which you have access. You can befriend additional eldamon as normal. Each day during your daily preparations, choose a number of eldamon equal to 3 or your key attribute modifier, whichever is less. You spend extra time with those eldamon, preparing to swap your phase with those eldamon throughout the day. Your eldamon gain levels alongside you as you train them, increasing to match your level whenever you level up. It's unlikely to befriend an eldamon of higher level than you, and even if you do, you can't share your phase with them.

Due to your metaphysical connection to your eldamon when you've swapped your personal phase with them, you share multiple attack penalties and actions (though you normally can't act), and you can use your Hero Points on their behalf.

Eldamon aren't the same as mortal creatures, and they don't die, even when it seems like they would be killed. An eldamon that reaches 0 Hit Points doesn't become unconscious or dying; they just phase out if they were phased in and become unresponsive. An eldamon that takes any amount of damage recovers all of their Hit Points after being phased out after an encounter, unless they were reduced to 0 Hit Points. If they were reduced to 0 Hit Points by an effect other than a death effect, they recover all their Hit Points after being phased out after the encounter for at least 1 minute. If reduced to 0 Hit Points by a death effect, an eldamon still doesn't die, but it does take longer for them to collect their energy. In that case, they remain unresponsive and out of phase for 1 hour.

You gain the @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.actions.Item.MEhjM8VvmsgbnOX8]{Phase Eldamon} activity and your eldamon gain the @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.actions.Item.TwHFeP0ZNdzk8GCJ]{Tug Conduit} action.

Trainer's Heart.name: Trainer's Heart
Trainer's Heart.description: Your bonds strengthen your heart. Your proficiency rank for Will saves increases to master. When you roll a success at a Will save, you get a critical success instead.

Transcend Element.name: Transcend Element
Transcend Element.description:
Your unique capacities intertwined with your eldamon's elemental energies have allowed you to transcend the normal boundaries of your element, delving into powers that would ordinarily only be available to one other element of your choice. Choose an element other than your own; you gain one 1st level power from that element's list, one power of 7th level or lower from that element's list, and one power of 11th level or lower from that element's list. When you gain new powers, you can choose a power from that element's list instead of your own, as long as the power is at least 4 levels lower than your level (11th level at 15th, 13th level at 17th, and so on). The powers you choose become powers of your element, though otherwise the power has its normal effects, even if that means it produces a damage type or condition that would be highly unusual for your element (such as fire damage for an ice elemental avatar). Think of an explanation as to how you can manifest these powers using your element. For instance, if your element is cold, you might choose electricity and describe your transcendence as cold temperatures producing superconductivity.

Instead of choosing an element other than your own, you can choose to transcend into your own element. In that case, you gain any three powers from your element, or universal powers, up to level 15.

Trick or Treat.name: Trick or Treat
Trick or Treat.description: You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Intimidation checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize}. When you harvest plants in a square with a foe in it, that foe is no longer temporarily immune to your Demoralize.

Triple Time.name: Triple Time
Triple Time.description: Three heads are better than one, so split up an area power's effect among your three heads. When you use a damaging power in a cone, line, or burst with a length or radius of at least 30 feet, you can instead create three smaller effects, one from each head. If you do, you create three lines or cones with 1/3 the original length (rounded down) or three bursts with 1/3 the original radius (rounded down). Even if a creature is in the area of more than one of the cones, lines, or bursts, it still only takes the effects of the power once.

Ultimate Power.name: Ultimate Power
Ultimate Power.description:
Eldamon Trainer Your eldamon have achieved the pinnacle of elemental power, granting them the ability to use an ultimate power. Each of your eldamon learns one of the ultimate powers from their element, in addition to their other powers. An ultimate power is extremely powerful and doesn't work like other powers. Ultimate powers significantly alter the elemental energies around them and drastically alter your phase whenever an eldamon uses them. As such, after any of your eldamon uses an ultimate power, none of your eldamon can use an ultimate power again for 1 hour, as the energies take time to coalesce and reshape.

Elemental Avatar Your transcendence has achieved the pinnacle of elemental power, granting you the ability to use an ultimate power. You learn one of the ultimate powers from your element. You automatically prepare that ultimate power each day, in addition to your other prepared elemental powers. An ultimate power is extremely powerful and doesn't work like other powers. Ultimate powers significantly alter the elemental energies around them and take significant energy from you each time you use them. As such, after using an ultimate power, you can't use an ultimate power again for 1 hour, as the energies take time to coalesce and reshape.

Undying Flame.name: Undying Flame
Undying Flame.description:
It’s particularly hard for others to put out your flames, and even an effective form of assistance helps less than usual. The flat check DCs for the persistent fire damage from your elemental powers increase from DC 15 to DC 16, or from DC 10 to DC 12 after especially effective assistance.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.8iVZqZQgvYx627rE]{Effect: Undying Flame}

Unyielding Elephant.name: Unyielding Elephant
Unyielding Elephant.description: You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your Fortitude or Reflex DC against attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} you. This bonus also applies to saving throws against spells or effects that attempt to knock you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. In addition, if any effect would force you to move 10 feet or more, you are moved only half the distance.

Veins of Ice.name: Veins of Ice
Veins of Ice.description: The cold pumping through your body chills out most forms of persistent damage, making it harder for them to last. Your flat check DC against persistent damage other than mental, vitality, and void damage (which attack your mind or life force directly) decreases from DC 15 to DC 12, or from DC 10 to DC 7 with especially effective assistance.

Vital Rest.name: Vital Rest
Vital Rest.description:
When you take a break, you surge with vital energy. During an encounter, if you don't act for a full round (usually because of a condition such as stunned or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, or because you Delayed for an entire round until your original initiative came again), you gain temporary Hit Points equal to 2 plus your level, which last for 2 rounds.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.w3NW5RdWlA9hk7fb]{Effect: Vital Rest}

Wall Off.name: Wall Off
Wall Off.description: Your body is essentially a wall, so it's difficult to move through your space. While Tiny creatures can still enter your space, they can't automatically cross through it, and they still need to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.21WIfSu7Xd7uKqV8]{Tumble Through} or use a similar ability. The DC to Tumble Through or use a similar ability against you is either your power DC or the usual DC with a +2 circumstance bonus, whichever is higher.

Water Element.name: Water Element
Water Element.description:
The element of water embodies the rush and constant change of currents and the ebb and flow of the tides. Just as water exists in a cycle, as a water user, if you learn to make the most of the changing tides, you can take control of the battlefield.

Current's Pull: Allies don't take damage from your water powers if they're in the area (or if you choose to target them), and they can choose any of the degrees of success from the power and allow the power to move them the appropriate distance. For instance, if you power doesn't move a creature on a critical success, pushes them 10 feet on a success, pushes them 20 feet on a failure, and pushes them 40 feet on a critical failure, your ally can choose to stay where they are or to be pushed 10, 20, or 40 feet (though the rushing water is too rapid for precise control, so they can't choose any distances in between).

Shifting Tides: Whenever you roll initiative, Refresh your powers in an encounter, or phase in if you're a water eldamon, choose high or low tide. This is your initial tide. Whenever you use a water power, you gain the effect of your current tide, then switch to the other tide (high tide becomes low tide, or low tide becomes high tide). In this way, you alternate your powers between the tides, until you refresh and change to whichever tide you prefer. You normally do not have a tide outside an encounter.

Underwater Bludgeoner: Bludgeoning water powers manipulate the water itself, so they don't take penalties underwater, even if they involve melee or ranged attacks.

Associated Damage Type: Bludgeoning

Associated Traits: Water

Water Key Terms

You'll see one or both of the following terms in almost every water elemental power. Typically, a water power has a special effect depending on if you are at high or low tide when you use it.

High Tide: At high tide, your powers push heedlessly outward, ready to break the shore. Any time a water power says it "moves" an enemy, if you're in high tide, you push the enemy directly away from you unless stated otherwise. High tide powers tend to deal additional damage, but they often come with a defensive drawback of some kind.

Low Tide: At low tide, your powers ebb back protectively toward you. Any time a water power says it "moves" an enemy, if you're in low tide, you pull the enemy directly toward you unless stated otherwise. Low tide powers tend to pull enemies toward you, and their damage is lower than at high tide, but they often come with a defensive benefit of some kind.

Other Abilities

If your element is water, you gain the following abilities and effects from the Elemental Surge action, the Elemental Shield action, and the elemental avatar feats that vary by element.

Elemental Locomotion You gain a swim Speed equal to your land Speed (or vice versa if you're an aquatic creature that normally doesn't have a land Speed) and can breathe underwater (or breathe air if you're an aquatic creature).
