If you're in high tide, you gain a +10-foot status bonus to your swim Speed, and if you're in low tide, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your AC against reactions triggered by your movement while swimming.

Elemental Manipulation When you use Elemental Manipulation, you can control water around you in minor ways, allowing you to move and filter small amounts of water, condense moisture in the air in a humid area into water, evaporate small amounts of water, and perform other similar actions as determined by the GM.

Elemental Resistance Your body is protected from and by water. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus on saving throws against water effects and gain resistance equal to half your level against water damage. If you have the Enhanced Resistance feat, your circumstance bonus on saving throws against water effects increases to +2.

Elemental Sculptor When you use the Elemental Sculptor feat, you can sculpt water, allowing you to move substantial amounts of water (up to 40 Bulk) located up to 20 feet away and taking up no larger than a 10-foot by 10-foot by 10-foot space up to 20 feet. You can also sculpt the water's form into fanciful shapes, though if the water doesn't have a container, it will splash into a puddle soon after you stop sculpting it.

Elemental Senses You notice tremors in the water around you. You gain wavesense as an imprecise sense out to 60 feet.

Elemental Shield The shield also gives you resistance to acid and fire equal to half your level while it lasts. For water eldamon, the resistance to fire is cumulative with their base resistance.

Elemental Surge You can push (if you're in high tide) or pull (if you're in low tide) the chosen creature 10 feet unless they succeed at a Fortitude save against your power DC. Since the Elemental Surge action isn't a power, using it doesn't shift your tide.

Enhanced Locomotion By calling forth tides of water around you, you can swim on land and in the air. You can use your swim Speed to Swim on land and into the air. When you do, you call a personal wave of water that carries you along as you Swim. If you're in a location that can't hold your weight, such as in midair, you fall at the end of your turn if you don't Swim at least once during your turn.

Weapon Expertise.name: Weapon Expertise
Weapon Expertise.description: You've dedicated yourself to learning the intricacies of your weapons. Your proficiency ranks for simple weapons and unarmed attacks increase to expert.

Weapon Specialization.name: Weapon Specialization
Weapon Specialization.description: You've learned how to inflict greater injuries with the weapons you know best. You deal an additional 2 damage with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you are an expert. This damage increases to 3 if you're a master, and 4 if you're legendary.

Wild Growth.name: Wild Growth
Wild Growth.description: When you sow plants, more plants grow around you. Any time you sow with a power, sow in a square you occupy or a square adjacent to you. If you're an expert in power DC, you sow in two such squares, if you're a master in power DC, you sow in three such squares, and if you're legendary in power DC, you sow in four such squares.

Wind Speed.name: Wind Speed
Wind Speed.description: Air energy speeds you up when using your air powers to move. You gain a +10-foot status bonus to your Speeds while moving with an air power. This increases to a +20-foot status bonus if you're an expert in power DC, a +30- foot status bonus if you're a master in power DC, and a +40-foot status bonus if you're legendary in power DC.

Wind's Mobility.name: Wind's Mobility
Wind's Mobility.description: Air rushes past you as you move, making it harder for your foes to harm you as long as you're in motion. While you're moving, you're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} and gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC. This only applies when you're in the midst of your own movement, not when you're moving due to the actions of another, such as when riding a vehicle or a mount.

Wood Element.name: Wood Element
Wood Element.description:
The element of wood embodies natural growth, as seen all across the plant kingdom. Thus, it focuses on powers that grow, building up by sowing plants across the battlefield in order to harvest the plants later for a greater effect. Wood users learn to follow the natural cycle of growth and balance their sowing and harvesting for maximum effect.

Associated Damage Type: Piercing

Associated Traits: Plant, Wood

Wood Key Terms

You’ll see one or both of the following terms in almost every wood elemental power. Typically, a wood power gives you the choice to sow or harvest.

Sow: When you choose to sow, you cause temporary foliage or other plants to sprout either in a location listed in the power, or in the power's area by default. You sow plants on the ground. Areas with these plants are always difficult terrain and might have different effects depending on the power, and the plants last either until you harvest them, until they are destroyed, or until you refresh, whichever comes first. Area of effect fire or ice damage destroys the plants you sowed in the area. You can sow plants in an area that already naturally has plants, but if you sow plants in an area that you already sowed plants, there's no additional effect; if one or both of the sowed plants had an additional effect depending on the power, you can choose one of the effects to keep in the overlapping area, but not both.

Harvest: You can only choose to harvest either in an area you've already sown plants or in an area that has thick enough natural vegetation to cause difficult terrain; otherwise, you must choose to sow with your power. You can't use plants sown by other creature's spells or abilities. If you harvest plants sown from your wood powers, they vanish, and if you harvest from natural vegetation, the vegetation remains, but you can't harvest from it again for 24 hours, as the plant's elemental wood energy replenishes. Normally, when you harvest for a power, that power grants you a special benefit for harvesting, but some powers indicate that the plants you sow with them have an additional benefit when harvested. In that case, you gain both benefits when harvesting that plant.

Other Abilities

If your element is wood, you gain the following abilities and effects from the Elemental Surge action, the Elemental Shield action, and the elemental avatar feats that vary by element.

Elemental Locomotion The plants get out of your way, allowing you to move through them with ease. You ignore any difficult or greater difficult terrain caused by plants and fungi, such as bushes, vines, and undergrowth. Even plants and fungi manipulated by magic don't impede your progress.

Elemental Manipulation When you use Elemental Manipulation, you can control non-creature plants around you in minor ways, allowing you to help them grow healthily, cause buds or flowers to open, make the plant wilt, and so on. At your GM's discretion, you can make other similar small adjustments.

Elemental Resistance Plants pull their punches against you. You gain resistance equal to half your level to damage from plant creatures and effects with the plant or wood traits. If you have the Enhanced Resistance feat, plant creatures with an Intelligence of –4 or –5 normally won't attack you unless compelled to do so by another creature.

Elemental Sculptor When you use the Elemental Sculptor feat, you can sculpt and control the position of plants to a greater extent than Elemental Manipulation. This allows you to create rough shapes and features out of plants in the area, roughly one 10-foot by 10-foot square at a time within 20 feet, potentially allowing for a larger sculpture over time, and also allows you to move around plants providing difficult terrain or cover to clear a path or create obstructions, including plants you sow with your wood powers. At the GM's discretion, you can make other similar adjustments to plants.

Elemental Senses You gain greensight, which allows you to see through living plants (though not wooden walls, doors, and the like) as if they were semi-transparent, allowing you to view what's on the other side.

Elemental Shield If there's a plant you can harvest in your space (or one of your spaces if you are Large or Larger), you can harvest all plants in your space as a free action when a foe attacks you and would hit your AC exactly, to increase the circumstance bonus to AC to 2, or 3 if you are an elemental avatar holding the elemental shield. The increased circumstance bonus applies to your AC when you're determining the outcome of the triggering attack, which normally makes the attack miss.

Elemental Surge You sow in either a 5-foot emanation or a 5-foot burst within 30 feet.

Enhanced Locomotion When you create plants using your powers, you can transform yourself into wood elemental energy to transport between them. As a single action, which has the move trait, you can briefly transition into wood energy and then reappear in a space where you sowed a plant with your power, or an adjacent space; either way, the space must be within 60 feet. You still need line of effect to the plant and you must be able to detect the plant with a precise sense, but you don't need to cross the intervening squares, allowing you to avoid obstacles and hazardous terrain, and this movement doesn't trigger reactions based on movement.

Wooden Sword and Shield.name: Wooden Sword and Shield
Wooden Sword and Shield.description: Your claws transform into the shape of a wooden sword and shield. This changes your claw unarmed attack into a blade arm unarmed attack that deals @Damage[1d8[slashing]] damage, loses the agile trait, and gains the versatile P trait; this is already reflected in the statistics above. Additionally, you can use your shield arm to Raise a Shield, with the effects of a wooden shield with 10 Hardness, 60 HP and a BT of 30. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.jM72TjJ965jocBV8]{Shield Block} reaction, which you can only use with your shield arm. When you refresh, your shield arm recovers all its Hit Points, even if it was destroyed.
